With the knowledgeable  guide who told a lot of the elephants life, how bad they were treated before and was a great joy to see they now and how well looked with the staff care. People should come here first before going to circus or other activities with animals. We were able to get close to the elephants, to feed them when they are getting walk.

title: Amazing visit and incredible experience
review: The center was incredibly helpful in arranging for us to go and visit on the same day after we accidentally tried to visit the taj mahal on a friday

title: Melts your heart
review: Take time out and visit these poor souls tortured and tormented by humans all these years  Brings a tear or two in eyes hearing and watching their plight and how insensitively these creatures of the wild have lived most of their lives.

title: Great day
review: The sanctuary was lovely and you can see they clearly care for the animals, we were able to feed and wash them which was so enjoyable. The only dissapointing thing was we didn't spend much time with them but overall it was a great day and made our trip! Would highly recommend.

title: Loved it
review: As a girl guiding group we found the experience very informative. We have gained a new kind respect for elephants we didn't see as clearly as when we first entered. We all found the document very hard to watch but rewarding to see the effort put into making the elephants lives better.

title: Excellent
review: we visit the center on July 2017.I had been following wild life's.o.s for years and more excited when I visited there.I am blessed with the opportunity to visit and brought my sister and son.If you an elephant lover this is the best place.wildlife s.o.s sanctuary for distressed elephants accepts both volunteers and visitors and focuses a lot on educating people about elephants and the issues they face in India..

title: Kindness
review: Offering abused, unwanted elephants years of social interaction with other elephants, veterinary care and healthy diet provided by dedicated carers and donations from the public. There is no government support.

title: Animal seeing
review: It is largest bear rescue in world and elephant conserving it has nominal fresh where u can enjoy n have fun.

title: Elephant Sanctuary
review: Having seen a poster about Wildlife SOS, on an earlier visit to India, I was keen to visit, on my next trip - which was with a group of girls, aged 14-18, from Girlguiding UK.  It was well worth the slight detour, on our coach drive to Delhi and everyone, both teenagers and adults, thoroughly enjoyed the experience - and learned a great deal, both about the cruel methods used to "train" elephants and the ways in which Wildlife SOS works first to rescue ill-treated working elephants and then to rehabilitate them.  It was inspiring to see the animals able to spend the rest of their lives in a safe and relatively natural environment.

title: Excellent Elephant Experience
review: Spent a fantastic few hours with the dedicated team at Wildlife SOS. Helped feed & bathe the elephants and our guide was very knowledgeable. It was a pleasure getting up close to the elephants. Would highly recommend visiting this amazing centre. Keep up the good work.

title: Excellent experience and charity
review: What an experience! We spent a magical day with the rescued elephants, assisting to shower them, prepare food and feed them, clean out their spaces and walk them in the open. So sad that humans can be so horrible to animals, but then when you meet the amazing people at Wildlife SOS and see the excellent work they are doing, it is amazing.

title: Elephant Sanctuary
review: We cannot speak more highly about this incredible place.  The suffering these poor elephants have gone through and to see them now is a humbling experience to say the least.  Anyone traveling to Agra must visit the elephant sanctuary and see the incredible work these guys are doing to improve the life's of these wonderful animals.

title: Amazing experience
review: Visiting the bear and elephant sanctuaries was one of the best thing we got to during our trip in India. It was truly amazing to see what the association manage to do to help the dancing bear and what they still do now. Our guide was really nice and interesting, we learned so many things! We got to see the bears really closely so it was really impressive.

title: The best thing I did in India!
review: Our visit was wonderful. We had our tour company book us in. We arrived and were greeted and given the history of Wildlife SOS and watched a short video. There was a waiver to fill out. Then we went outside. The elephants were out on their daily walk so we meat with two females and their handler. We spent 30 minutes hanging out feeding them bananas and standing there awe struck by their beauty. We then toured the sanctuary learning all about the different female elephants we met, how they've formed relationships, where they were found, their dietary needs and exercise regime. All along different elephants came up to check us out and meet us. It was wonderful to see how this magnificent creatures are cared for. Our guide was also in charge of the diets and making food engaging and helping to mentally stimulate the elephants so they don't get bored. It was amazing. If you're going to visit Agra take the detour to come here you won't regret it.

title: Really special experience
review: Went with my family.  Be forewarned you have to pay to get in the park and then provide a sizeable donation to the sanctuary as well.   For us the visit was well worth it, we got a guided 2 hour tour of the facility and learned a lot about the Bears and the history.   If you want to see both the elephants and bears you need to get their around 1 or 2pm at the latest.

title: This place is awesome and best for hang out
review: I have visited this place many times and I always found this place clean and healthy surrounding.

title: Wonderful Place!!!
review: My Son loves this place very much. Its about an hour distance from Agra. We visit the Elephant Sanctuary. It was really very good to visit the place.

title: Amazing!
review: Visited here with a team of 15 young people and 3 adults, about an hour's drive from Agra. On arriving we were met by the Educational Officer & taken to a portacabin to hear about the centre and complete a waiver. We were taken outside & toured the Wildlife SOS, we heard about the nature of the injuries inflicted upon the elephants, how the programme looks after the rescued elephants, we saw & learned about their feeding, bathing & exercising habits, how the vets administered medicine to help the healing process. It was fascinating & to top it all we helped with the scrubbing, bathing & feeding of the elephants. It felt surreal washing an elephant but an amazing experience! The Educational Officer was outstanding & we thank you for an amazing visit.

title: So happy we visited Wildlife SOS!!
review: I have been donating to Wildlife SOS for a couple of years and never thought I would be able to visit them! The sanctuary is about an hour away from Agra, so after visiting the Taj Mahal and Agra, we headed to visit the elephant sanctuary. I must say it was one of the highlights of our trip! The staff and caretakers were amazing and so committed! Would love to go back!

title: looking for an amazing experience?
review: The Wildlife SOS Elephant & Bear Sanctuary was an incredible experience for everyone to enjoy. Being able to feed, pet and enjoy the elephants company was an experience I will never forget. Thank you to the rescue team who saves these elephants from their awful circumstances, I will never forget it.

title: What an inspirational place!
review: Myself and my husband recently spent a week volunteering with Wildlife SOS and I can honestly say that I have never seen an organisation which takes greater care of animals. Many of the animals that we helped to look after, both at the Elephant Care and Conservation Centre and the Sloth Bear Rehabilitation Centre, have lived quite difficult lives before Wildlife SOS rescued them. Now they have lots of space to roam and play, specific enrichment and a healthy diet which caters for the individual needs of each and every animal.

title: Absolutely amazing month volunteering here
review: Volunteered here for 4 weeks, switched between the bears and the elephants every day. Animals are amazing and the staff were so friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this charity above others, as the animal welfare is top priority and they don't offer things such as elephant riding.

title: Wildlife SOS
review: A very worthwhile visit to see first hand the hard work going in to rescue and care for elephants and bears.  The staff are very knowledgeable and committed to their work with these animals. A first class experience

title: My experience
review: I thoroughly enjoyed the experience, it was amazing. I personally did not think i would enjoy it but i loved every moment from start to finish. I learnt more about elephants and how wildlife SOS came to be about and how much they help animals.

title: Hidden gem on trip from Delhi to Agra
review: We planned this visit long before our trip based on other reviews and our love of animals. It was about 2/3rds of the way on our drive from Delhi to Agra. They have set 2 hour tours where you learn about the rescue efforts, and have the opportunity to feed and care (wash, see the vet give medication, etc...) for the elephants. The stories of how the elephants got there is terribly sad, but the team of volunteers and staff give you hope. Their next project is to raise money for more land so the number of elephants served can increase and so the current ones can have bigger paddocks.

title: Enriching, educational and touching visit.
review: It contributes to change the way you look at some turistic attractions and to make aware about the important labour Wildlife SOS is doing in India.

title: Well worth the trip
review: We visited the elephant sanctuary as a small group of students and it was excellent. We learnt a lot about the treatment of captive elephants and the very important work being done here. The grounds are very basic but everything is focused on attending to these beautiful animals. We could interact with the animals that had been rehabilitated more but some had been too traumatised to allow interaction. I applaud all the volunteers at SOS, they are doing an amazing job. Go and support them!

title: Excellent Place to go!
review: This is a must place to visit when you are in Arga. Hearing about the rescue stories of the animals is very touching and i would recommend it to everying.

title: Elephants
review: Washing the elephants and feeding them was fun! The staff are very enjoyable to wash the elephants with

title: World challenge
review: The visit was amazing and we all had a lot of fun. I think the world needs people like you to save the animals and made India a better place. I hope you guys get the chance to save many many more elephants and bears and give them the life they deserve.

title: Incredibly moving experience
review: We had a wonderful afternoon out walking with the rescued female elephants. The dedicated team here do fantastic work and they patiently answered all our questions. It was one of the highlights of our holiday. Please do stop off on your way to Agra and support this organisation.

title: Volunteering
review: What a beautiful sanctuary housing such majestic creatures. Not only are they caring for elephants who have been mistreated in the past but are also working to shut-down horrible modern practices such as the use of elephants as tourist transport at Amber Fort. Big love for this place.

title: Elephant sanctuary
review: I visited this as a world challenge group and was blown away by the workers knowledge of the elephants and what their lives were like before being rescued. We ere equally amazed with the care they provide these rescued elephants for the rest of their lives! We got to bathe and feed multiple elephants on our two hour visit and it was Absolutely a once in a lifetime experience! In saying that I will be coming back to experience this again with my mother to volunteer at the sanctuary I hope. Thank you so much guys, we wish you all the best with your rescues!

title: Amazing...
review: If you can find the time you just have to visit this place and give the team your support. Doing an incredible job in tough circumstances..

title: Please visit and continue to spread awareness
review: Along with 2 girlfriends, we visited both the bear and animal rescue centers. This was at the end of our trip to Ladakh, and after visiting the Taj Mahal. Truly inspirational the work that is being done by SOS to improve the lives of these bears and elephants. We were able to participate in both bathing and feeding the elephants. Just being around these beautiful creatures is such an emotional experience, enhanced by the love and devotion of their caregivers.  There is a special place in heaven for these caregivers. Definitely visit here when in Agra and spread the word.

title: Great pleasure
review: no enough words to describe this place but amazing good i love to visit again soon as soon as possible

title: Eye opening
review: It is eye opening learning about the cruelty these animals have suffered during their life, and the animals that are still enslaved that live with pain daily.

title: Great job to protect indian endemic bears
review: We loved to visit the sanctuary and appreciate the good work that the team is doing there to recuperate the dancing bears. Worthy to support them as they don't get too much economic support rather than what ngo's and individuals are giving them.

title: Beautiful animals and caring staff
review: The worker were obviously passionate and compelled towards helping these beautiful animals. They explained all about the mistreatment of them and explored all the things the sanctuary are doing to help.

title: Real animal shelter
review: Have visited other elephant protection places in India, which turn out to be commercial facilities. In this place, elephants are kept more in natural surroundings where they can freely roam, have dust baths and live together.

title: Phenomenal Work, Visit and Support!
review: This animal sanctuary is a remarkable NGO, propelling strong social change. Wildlife SOS protects the livelihoods of animals, rescuing them from abusive circumstances and focusing on longterm protection and rehabilitation. They are extremely educational, and promote sustainable development goals for they also have ongoing social projects focusing on alternative income strategies for less privileged individuals. Definitely recommend volunteering here, and supporting this meaningful work!

title: Sharing an important work
review: My hushband and I went to visit the elephant sanctuary. The visit was really interesting and the work they share with us seems really important. We were really happy to help give its bath to one of the elephant. The price for the visit is quite expensive, but we consider it more like a donation to an important cause. I recommend this visit. It's also a great break from Agra's noise!

title: Wildlifesos
review: We absolutely loved our time at the Elephant sanctuary, and commend the brilliant work the staff and volunteers are doing there. The Elephants were clearly well looked after and cared for. Our guide (although we cannot remember his name) was fantastic in informing us on the condition of the Elephants before coming to the sanctuary, as well as daily life for them and the keepers. He answered all of our questions and was very friendly and helpful. We only hope that this fantastic work continues, and that other people continue to visit and spread awareness about the Indian Elephants. Thank you for the experience.

title: Small but caring elephant care centre
review: We called into the elephant care centre on the off chance that we could see the elephants. Luckily he agreed and although we cheekily negotiated a cheaper entry price of 1000 rupees per person, having seen the wor k and care that was being done we gave the full price of 1500 per person.

title: Amazing Experience
review: It was brilliant to see how well the elephants are treated here I would recommend everyone taking the time out to visit this great cause.

title: enjoyable experience
review: I loved hearing about their work to save and protect the bears. Our guide spoke very good English which was nice.

title: excellent facilities
review: My husband and I spent one week at the elephant sanctuary and we loved it. The elephants are very well looked after and cared for. The whole team is very welcoming and friendly and the elephant carers very cooperative. I have seen and stayed at many elephant sanctuaries in Asia and this one is very good, no chains, no hooks which is not that common. We would definitely recommend it to anyone.

title: Amazing
review: We were treated so well and given opportunities to interact with phenomenal creatures. The people are caring and extremely knowledgeable. We had the trip of a lifetime.

title: So good!
review: Really good and ethical way to see elepants! Also very educational and interesting- we learnt about what elephants have to go through in various parts of the world and also about wildlife sos' previous project ok sloth bears.

title: Amazing cause; amazing visit!! Support them, please!
review: We had a wonderful experience with Wildlife SOS's elephant sanctuary. They are an amazing with a noble mission, humane approach, and wonderful staff and we encourage everyone possible to visit and support them. On top of just being a wonderful organization, the experience is really fun! We got to get very close to the elephants and touch them, feed them, bathe them, and walk with them! It was really amazing and we would love to go back again and further support. Thanks so much, Wildlife SOS!

title: Fabulous experience
review: A memorable and truly exceptional experience with the elephants. From washing them to feeding them while being told about the life they had before the sanctuary rescued them. The couple of hours spent with them and their keepers who look after and devote themselves to their care and rehabilitation was humbling and touching.

title: May is too hot for this - but worth it still.
review: It was a learning experience coming here and seeing the bears - although I have some concerns about the way the staff conducts their tours.  It seems like they parade you around the premises without much order and then watching the informational video is redundant since they explain most of it in the beginning of the tour.  All in all they are providing a good service to the bears - and glad we went.

title: Very Different Experience
review: We had a very wonderful time and really hats off to these people for doing such a tramondos job for these speechless creatures

title: Better than the Taj? Yes, yes it was
review: I was warned that this sanctuary might be similar to the one a few cities away that claims to be a sanctuary when in fact it is not.

title: Incredible Experience, highlight of our India trip!
review: Visiting Wildlife SOS and volunteering with the astounding elephants was the absolute highlight of our entire India trip.  We had the honor of feeding and bathing these gentle giants, and also had the opportunity to take them for their evening walk.  We learned so much from the knowledgeable Wildilfe SOS guides, and were so excited to meet the "celebrity" elephants that we have been following (and donating to) on social media for years.  We did the full day volunteering, which was a must to get to truly interact with the elephants.  Cannot recommend the experience enough!!

title: ELEPHANT CONSERVATION CENTRE
review: A wonderful and heart touching experience. Good to see the work being done by the staff, all sincere and dedicated to the cause of Saving and Conserving the Elephant.

title: Wildlife SOS
review: We were so impressed by the care the elephants receive at this amazing organization. Our guide was very knowledgeable and obviously really cared about the elephants they rescued. We heard their back stories (which were mostly sad), and then how they all have gotten a second chance.  We got to spend time with several of the elephants, walking with them, feeding them, and even taking a bath with one!  it was one of the best things we did when we visited India.

title: Brilliant
review: We visited the centre without booking but they kindly let us in for a visit. It was really great to see the elephants, they are so well cared for and you can see the staff really care about them. As usual in these rescue centres you hear the sad stories about their lives before and it is heartbreaking but now they are being well cared for and it is amazing. Loved the place and also my 11 year old son. We also went to the bear sanctuary which brought tears to my eyes they seem to have a harder time to recover. I have to say a big thank you to SOS for helping these animals and also helping to change the minds of people, that these practices are no longer acceptable.

title: Better than the Taj Mahal!
review: I coordinate the Study Abroad program for a mid-sized university. Our nursing and physical therapy students visit India annually to offer free medical care to residents of Puttur. As a part of their trip, we always include some sightseeing. This year, rather than riding an elephant, we educated our students about the treatment of riding and begging elephants, and they unanimously agreed to visit Wildlife SOS's elephant facility in Mathura instead. What an eye-opener! They were able to bathe and visit with several of the elephants up close and stay with them for dinner.  They were very enthusiastic about the educational portion of the visit as well. After their return, all of them agreed that this experience was their most cherished (aside from their medical experiences); given the choice, they would go to Wildlife SOS rather than the Taj Mahal! They are in love and plan to sponsor their favorite elephant as a group. I can't say enough good things about how easy it was to set up the tour, and how welcomed our group felt. WSOS seems able to accommodate small or large groups. They were very agreeable when we needed to change the date of the visit. Although the site is (naturally) slightly off the beaten path, we had no difficulty arranging for transportation through a local guide. This will be a part of every trip to India that we plan from now on!

title: Life changing experience - Amazing organization!!
review: We had the honor of visiting Wildlife SOS elephant sanctuary in Agra on May 19th 2017. Besides wanting to see the Taj Mahal, our trip to Agra was to get to know the elephant sanctuary. Our trip from the hotel to the facilities was so worthy!!! We love every moment of spending time at the facilities even though we only went there for less than 2 hours since we got late to our appointment. Our education officer was Mr. Harendra and we can't thank him enough for telling us the story of each of the female elephants. We also got the chance of feeding some of the elephants and spend some time with them.

title: Safe haven for elephants
review: My friend and I travelled over an hour to the sanctuary from Agra to visit the elephant care facility. We had pre-booked a time slot for 2-4, however the team at the elephant center seemed not to have known we were coming. Nonetheless, Shiwa (I hope that is how to spell his name) was quick and eager to begin our tour and educate us on the mistreatment of elephants in India. It was a real eye opener and has made me shocked at the amount of terror these mammals witness. The guide is very personal and you are able to ask any questions that you may have. Just as a recommendation, it may be helpful for the admin team to suggest better timings for visits, as between 2-4 there is not much happening at the sanctuary and it is mainly before or after this time that you have the potential to feed or Join the elephants on their evening walk. However, despite the slight admin issue, the compassion and love of the keepers at the sanctuary is striking and made the whole visit a true joy!

title: You need to come here
review: An absolute must visit. My friend who has a huge interest in animals booked this for us, which was fantastic as I don't have a big interest in animals at all, but this was unbelievable. Hearing about the disgraceful and horrific conditions the elephants were kept was incredibly sad, but seeing them thrive and enjoy themselves in the centre in Agra was awe inspiring. These people are doing tremendous work and need to be visited.

title: Great Organization
review: The story of each of these bears is very sad and troubling.  This organization is very knowledgeable and definitely a worthwhile visit.  It is located in the Agra Bird Sanctuary so you will have to pay to get in there and then again to get into the bear rescue facility.  Does not cost much and well worth it.  Plan on purchasing something that was handmade by the previous bear owners, again, does not cost much and is much appreciated.

title: Heart and Soul
review: To be short, me and my partner left our heart and soul in this place. Truly amazing, no much words to say. The place have been found through Tripadvisor. Amazing place and staff is on top.Please note, that admission fee ( 2000 rupees)  is covering food for those extremely cute animals that had gone through a lot in their life, but were so lucky to be saved by real angels.

title: Commendable Work
review: You rarely see such dedication and selfless service to animals. Dr Baiju and his team are doing excellent work not o my for the bears that they rescue but also countless other animals,birds and reptiles that they help rehabilitate. Commendable ! It us a pleasure to go there and see for yourself their genuine concern for the animals they rehabilitate. One can also volunteer to work for them.

title: Elephant Conservation and Care Centre + Bear Rescue Facility
review: It was very emotional yet amazing experience for my family along with me after knowing about the pain that has been faced by these innocent creatures. These centres are trying their best to give their due love and care of nature back to them which was deprived since their early and young age. Still lot to do and we pledged to do our share.............

title: If you want to help animals, come to this place
review: I really liked this place that takes care of mistreated animals. We traveled around India and were very sad that animals are abused in most places. It was nice to find a place that is making the difference. This place rescue animals and give them space to be free from abuse.

title: Good Venue, Admirable Work
review: We visited both the elephant and bear sanctuary with two kids. Admirable work being done by team in rescue and rehabilitation of the animals. Interesting thing was also how the Wildlife SOS team is helping regeneration of the Kalandar families and their children.

title: Great experience
review: Learned many things about the elephants n their living environment

title: Good objective, regular experience
review: The reason of being of the Sanctuary is adorable but the experience could be improved adding more interactive activities with the elephants.

title: Must visit
review: It is inspirational how this group is tirelessly helping animals and giving them a safe area to be themselves. The animals are being given their dignity back and are allowed to express their natural behaviours despite horrific pasts. Please visit and support this group.

title: Save the Elephants
review: I had the great pleasure visiting the Wildlife SOS Elephant in India with a group of students (27) and we were so happy to see some happier and healthier elephant down the park that were saved from years of abuse or just major illness. GO "SOS ELEPHANTS" you are doing a great job and can't wait to visit again.

title: Wild life
review: Elephant and beer sanctuary of agra is a well planned wild life prevention park..good for nature lover and specially for kids and student to know them about nature and wild life..

title: Third visit to this amazing place.
review: To see first hand was is being done to assist with the rehabilitation and safety of bears and elephants in India is a real privilege. Also to see how the people who had depended on using these animals to earn money are trained in other worthwhile work in order to feed their families.

title: boring
review: We went there, and they were only showing us eleghants and telling the stories about them. It was boring because we did not touch them, feed them nor bathe them...which three of these I did in another wildlife SOS Elephant Sanctuary. So basically, we paid a lot to only get to know the stories about their life. I don't think it was worth it at all, and I will not recomend this visit to anyone.

title: It was heart touching to see the elephants, the SOS staff looked after the elephants very well & feed them adequately.
review: Someone thought to look after these elephants who were neglected by the owners (society). And these humble animals are looked after by the expert & professional staff. One should visit these rescue centre as it is off the beten tourist site & the money supports these poor elephants. Its simply good Karma to go to this place !!

title: Amazing and rewarding experience
review: My daughter, her husband and I recently visited Wildlife SOS elephant sanctuary and cannot say enough good things about this wonderful organization.   The care that is given to these elephants is just wonderful.  We were invited to feed and help bathe them and each elephants' story was shared with us.  Their sad lives are so changed through the work of Wildlife SOS.  They are so well cared for and are able to live out their lives happily.  We had such a wonderful time during our short two hour visit.  The taxi driver we requested through them worked out perfectly also.  We couldn't have asked for a better experience.

title: Wildlife SOS is a place to learn, care amd live an AMAZING experience!
review: It is an experience that you will never forget. However, go to a zoo if if you want to see animals in captivity in a a tiny circus-like enclosure where they are treated horribly and not looked after well, go to wildelife SOS if you really care about animals and want to help. It is a good place to take young children who ate eager to learn and develop their mind because you have to live the experience and this place does it 100%. Don't expect to touch them or handle them in any way because they are ill or injured however you you can help and support them by buying their souvenirs(the money will go to the women who make them) donating money or even help out. The animals safety, happiness and freedom will always come first.

title: Assome place
review: Its was amazing placd to view the animals and also be see different types of small and big animals to see the beauty of the nature

title: Fascinating experience
review: We had a very informative and interesting tour of the elephant project - introduced to all the individual elephants and their traumatic histories. Very pleased to see the high standard of care of this organisation who are also educating the elephants'  previous keepers and finding them alternative employment. Thoroughly recommended.

title: Educational and rewarding experience
review: While travelling in the region, a friend and I made a trip to the Wildlife SOS Elephant Sanctuary and had a memorable experience, learning about their rescue, rehabilitation work and seeing first hand their efforts to care for these majestic animals who have been through such horrifying situations while previously in captivity.  What I found very special was that rather than simply vilifying those who had been responsible for the past abuse of the elephants, Wildlife SOS makes rehabilitation of their owners a priority, recognizing that the context of abuse is often linked to cycles of poverty, socio-economic disempowerment, lack of education and skills, etc.  It was a real joy to see the elephants in a safe and caring environment and to see the creative and holisitic approach to their rescue work.  It was both an educational experience as well as a rewarding opportunity to see the elephants.  I look forward to going to see the bear sanctuary when I am next in India.  Please keep up the wonderful work, Wildlife SOS!

title: Nice
review: It was good...".......great to see animals with my family.....my kids got very excited by seeing this place...

title: Taking a walk with the giants
review: Wildlife S.O.S was a blast. Getting out and walking with the elephants as they go on their afternoon walks and then getting to feed them was awesome. Also, getting to know the back stories about the elephants makes the experience that much better. The staff deeply cares about their elephants and it's nice to see them finally being taken care of like they should be.

title: Wonderful Day
review: This was one of the best days of my holiday.  To be so close to these magnificent creatures was a privilege in itself but to be able to wash and feed the elephants was amazing.  It's lovely knowing they are safe and well looked after but heart breaking knowing there are still so many elephants that need to rescued.  A wonderful, wonderful day.

title: Amazing experience bathing rescued elephants
review: We visited the elephant sanctuary during a company trip and were invited to bathe and feed the elephants. The sanctuary team told us about the elephants they have there and about their past and present life. I wonderful experience altogether. Worth visiting and supporting their efforts!

title: Amazing experience
review: What an amazing organisation!! A real eye opener into the treatment of elephant and bears and how wildlife sos are fighting back to save them! Would love to go again. Loved walking with the elephants too!!

title: Very interesting tour of the bear sanctuary
review: We were very interested and moved to visit the bear sanctuary, where they look after former dancing bears.  They do their best to make these appallingly mistreated bears comfortable in "retirement".  The psychological effects of what they have been through are plain to see and it is touching to appreciate the love and care they are now being given.

title: Life changing experience
review: Our visit to the wildlife SOS elephant sanctuary was the best part of our trip to India. A little out of the way but completely worth it. I'd love to go back and volunteer next time.

title: Great experience!
review: This was a wonderful hands on experience that allowed us to interact with some of the most magnificent animals

title: A special experience
review: A very moving visit to see the very passionate and determined work that the Wildlife SOS team have been doing to rescue bears, elephants and other wildlife. Seeing these animals in a relaxed environment is very special and to be recommended .

title: Amazing experience
review: Hello everyone, I have been to Agra WildLife Sos as a volunteer and it was one of the most incredible experience of my lIfe. Even if you don't want to volunteer for a week you can come a day visit the center and help them as much as you can. Elephants are incredible being after all their suffering by the hands of humans and all of them who support those treatments by going to the circus... they still have enought hearts to forgive.

title: Ok, but nothing great
review: I thought we would be ble to interact with the elephants, but this was not the case.  We watched a film and then walked over to the enclosures where the elephants were kept.  Equivalent to going to the zoo at home.

title: Wildlife Sanctuary with Trained and Educational Animal's World!
review: What I say is Wildlife Sanctuary with Trained and Educational Animal's World!  Loveable place for my Kid to feed and watch the elephants along with their activity, Worthy & Must visit  Wildlife SOS Elephant & Bear Sanctuary which will be a memorable trip for your family.

title: See Elephants being properly cared for
review: I loved the visit. Helped to wash and feed the elephants.  I would happily go again for longer as I would have liked to walk with the elephants if I had known this was possible.

title: Unforgettable experience
review: After having visited the bear sanctuary in April 2015 and being deeply impressed with the facilities and conservation and rescue efforts, we were even more touched by the experience in the elephant sanctuary. Also here the facilities are completely focussed on the needs of the animals and run by a dedicated compassionate team. Communications officer Mr Harendra Singh gave us an excellent overview about Wildlife SOS and an in-depth introduction to the elephants and their heartbreaking stories of abuse and neglect. We were allowed ample time to observe the female elephants Suzy, Asha, Peanut, Coconut, Sita, Rhea, Mia, Chanchal, Phoolkali, Laxmi and Bijli. Some of them are blind (either by deliberate action or due to malnourishment) but get help from the younger ones with good eye sight. Their bonding and emotional support for each other is amazing. And we could feed Maya! She eats 100kg sugar cane per day, 60kg green grass stuff, 30kg fruits and vegetables and 10kg porridge.We will never in our lives forget the touch of her trunk when she took the fruits and vegetables gently out of our hands. While it is utterly incomprehensible why anybody can mistreat and abuse these wonderful creatures, it gives hope and energy to work for change to experience Wildlife SOS and the people who have created and are running it. The elephants themselves teach us all we need to know about compassion, dignity and respect. Visit and spread the word!

title: Very educational, enlightening and fun guided tour
review: I called up the center and spoke to Madhumita who was very accommodating and gave us an excellent guided tour of the facility. She is a very good English narrator and has a lot of patience in explaining the great work wildlife SOS is doing for bears and other wild animals in India.

title: Must see Place
review: This is a must see place in Agra, which is in national highway no 2. so it is good to go there by own vehicle.

title: Decent tour, just don't go with high expectation
review: It is a guided tour for two different areas. One for elephants, other for bear. It was okay, nothing much you can do apart from seeing the animals. Somehow felt like between a zoo and a sanctuary.

title: Disappointed
review: Stopped there after leaving Agra. The tour was none existent. We just saw a movie about both locations, bear and elephant.

title: Amazing experience
review: Spent 3 hours at the Elephant Sanctuary followed by a 15 minute drive to the Bear Sanctuary where we spent 2 hours.

title: Pleasant Experience
review: How much you will enjoy this place depends on the expectations that you have before. The tour is officially 2 hours (practically 1 hour) and costs about USD 24. The amount you give is considered a donation and goes for supporting the activities of the center. So, if you want to contribute to such a cause, you will have a good time. Otherwise, the interaction with the elephants is quite limited. I had the spot 11:00 to 13:00 that means I got to feed them. If you take the 16:00-18:00, then you get to walk with the elephants (you can write before hand an email to ask what activity happens at what hour). If you aim to get a lot of interaction with the animals, then I would recommend the elephant village in Jaipur.

title: Good to visit in Agra
review: Good interesting experience, we really liked Shiva (not sure about the name), he was really calm and nice. Harry was good too, but a bit too relaxed. The experience was an interesting one, we had to pick u elephant's poop, which wasn't what we expected, so that was different. The elephants were cute, a bit pricey but if you want to donate, then it helps the sanctuary.

title: Best Wildlife with Taj mahal
review: It's best visit for wild with taj mahal .an amazing place to visit elephants in jugle .Always take if you are on wild tour in forest.Thanks

title: The high point of our trip to India
review: Our visit to the Elephant Sanctuary (the Elephant and Bear sanctuaries are in different places) was a last-minute addition to our trip and so we only spent a couple of hours there.  We were shown around by Harshad who explained the work of the sanctuary and their care schedule for the elephants.  He then took us around and 'introduced' us to the elephants telling us their stories, some of which were heartbreaking.

title: Sloth Bear where are you?
review: Beware at this site. You are charged entry which was fine, then charged for car, then charged for something you don't see. Then they ask if you will be taking photos and that was also charged even more than the other 3 together. When you arrive at the sanctuary there is a big notice saying no photography. However there is a way round that ....pay another big amount to get closer to the bears with a guide. This was a scam for sure to extract as much money as they could, including a lie at the start. The paddock where the bears are kept looked sad , tired and dirty. I am pretty sure any donations or adoption fees go into dirty little pockets not into helping the bears. Very disappointed and very upset with the scam.

title: A well run non-profit, and responsible (and fun) way to spend time with elephants.
review: There are 3,500 working elephants in India.  According to Wildlife SOS, many of them live in less than optimal living situations and/or are abused.  This conservancy was set up about five years ago to rescue those elephants in the most dire situations.  Today there are 35 elephants on the property.  We spent about 90 minutes at the conservancy, learned about their mission and took a tour of the facilities - were able to feed the elephants.  Super interesting, very well run and our 12 year old twins loved it.  An authentic and real way to interact with elephants, while understanding their significance in India culture.  Much better than hiring an elephant to take you up to Amber Fort in Jaipur.  During our two week trip, this was a Top 5 experience.  Call ahead to make a reservation.  Perfect to do if you are driving from Delhi and Agra (the conservancy is about a hour outside of Agra).  We left Delhi at 9am, arrived at the conservancy around 11:30am, left there around 1pm and arrived at our hotel in Agra (Oberoi) around 2pm. PS:  Dancing Bears are at a different location.

title: worth a visit
review: We all know Agra is a heritage city for its historical monuments but don't much about Sur Sarovar or Keetham lake and Wildlife SOS bear rescue centre.Just outskirt of Agra on NH 2 towards Delhi a most spectacular place on the bank Yamuna river spread over 8 sq.km. situated Sur sarovar bird sanctuary the temporary and permanent home for 170 migratory birds. Near to the lake and on the bank of Yamuna river is Wildlife SOS bear rescue centre. Gone are those days when bears were used to dance on roads for an earning to their owners,bears are no more in the captivity by the law made by Govt,of India.Please make visit,i assure you won't be disappointed. Thanks. Ashit Kumar Das

title: Great visit - worth  the time
review: Sanctuary is very organized and  well staffed.  Staff are very knowledgeable and polite.  Our group had a tour of the elephant sanctuary only (no bears) where we washed and feed elephants and learned about their life before being rescued and brought to the sanctuary.   Bring something to change into that you do not mind getting wet in case you have a chance to wash the elephants.

title: Must see! Amazing care & love
review: We got the opportunity to see this wonderful sanctuary as part of our tour guide. It was an amazing experience to see how lovingly the elephants were looked after and getting much needed care away from previous settings where, unfortunately, too often they are abused and tortured without regard.

title: this place is uo there withthe taj mahal
review: We visited yesterday for a couple of hours. The elephants, who have suffered so much at the hands of their previous owners, are looked after and so very much loved by the  amazingly devoted staff and volunteers. You must remember this is a rescue centre and not a zoo and the most important thing is the wellbeing of the elephants. I was lucky enough to be able to feed an elephant and see them being washed. Harry took us around and was able to answer all of our questions and knew so much.

title: Great to see all of the amazing work carried out by the charity
review: Visiting Wildlife SOS Bear and Elephant sanctuary was my main motivation for coming to India, and it didn't disappoint. Myself and my friend visited on our own and were met by Abi, who took us around the centre and explained all of the vital work that they do. It was very informative and we got to ask questions, feed to elephants and see the progress to elephants have made. We also visited the bear sanctuary which was amazing - the facilities were great and the bears clearly thought so too! Without a doubt my favourite day of the year so far - thank you so much to the team for all of the vital work they do in giving mistreated animals a chance. Wildlife SOS also arranged for a car to pick us up from our hotel, which was really handy and not too expensive! If you do one thing in India, visit Wildlife SOS - thank you!!!

title: a blessing
review: Thank heavens this place exists, with its dedicated staff so proud of their work. Saving long-tormented creatures and giving them a better life is so worthwhile. The staff is welcoming and eager to explain their efforts.

title: Visit rescue elephants!
review: The bear and the elephant sanctuaries (2 different locations) run by Wildlife SOS are a marvel to behold. Dedicated staff have actually changed the world for dancing bears and completely eradicated the practice in India.  They are not quite there to do the same for elephants but mighty efforts are being made. Day visits and volunteering stays are highly recommended! It will change the way you see these animals, I promise!

title: Great place and mission
review: We visited the elephant sanctuary with our 2 little kids. They loved feeding the elephants and watching them get bathed. The guide was very nice and earnest. The place has an awesome mission of rescuing abused animals so we hope they continue to get support!

title: Amazing elephants - incredible charity
review: We visited the elephant sanctuary and it was fantastic, we fed the elephants and took a short stroll with them. Hearing the heartbreaking stories really did devastated us but these stories strike a passion to spread the message of saying no to tourism that's promoting cruelty. Wildlife sos do an amazing job and should be proud of their wonderful achievements .

title: Beautiful elephants
review: What a place, and what sad yet uplifting stories we heard of these beautiful creatures.  The staff work so hard and with such care.  More support is needed so the conservation can continue.  It was the best best place to visit and learn.

title: Our visit at the elephant sanctury
review: Wow what a fantastic place! I have just spent a week at the elephantcenter together with my husbond, and it has been such an unforgettible experience. The staff and the elephants make this place so filled with love, respect and wisdom, and it is completely impossible not to feel happy there. I have my deepest respect for the way the staff is taking care of these animals, and thank you so much for giving us volenteers such a lovely time and the possibility to learn, watch and experience what this place is all about.

title: Beautiful Elephants and Bears! Amazing and inspirational place to visit or volunteer!
review: I have just returned home after spending 2 weeks volunteering there with the beautiful rescued elephants and Sloth bears. What an incredible and wonderful experience I had. It was so touching to spend time with these amazing animals and to learn about their backgrounds and the wonderful work Wildlife SOS are doing in making their lives so much better. Equally important is the incredible work they are doing to help preserve the animals still living in the wild. While I was there, I was lucky enough to see a wonderful presentation by one of the founders of Wildlife SOS, what an amazing and inspirational human being. All the team there are so dedicated and loving towards the animals, which they so deserve after the lives they have had.

title: Coming to Agra & Wildlife SOS Bear Sanctuary is a MUST.
review: It is so heartening to learn the Elephants are also part of this beautiful Sanctuary.

title: Elephant visit!
review: We had an excellent visit to the Elephant refuge!  Abi took us around and educated us with the facility and their goals!  He was very nice to us and explained it all well.  I highly recommend a visit!

title: Way to go Wildlife SOS!!!
review: Excellent facilities and great work done by all employees and volunteers. Clean facilities and well looked after bears and elephants. All animals should visit and donate for this cause

title: Wildlife SOS
review: Spent the day here.  Once again its heartbreaking to see what we do to animals for our entertainment and profit. Thankfully Wildlife SOS rescue sloth beers from the cruel entertainment  of dancing bears and give them a happy retirement

title: Elephant and Bear Sanctuary
review: Spent the day learning about what these lovely creatures have had to endure and how the sanctuary has transformed their lives. Great day out! Definitely worth the trip to both of staying in Agra.

title: Volunteering
review: If anyone would like to have an experience working with the carers of the bear and elephant sanctuary, then I would recommend this entirely. To actually participate is an experience and truly rewarding.

title: Excellent!!
review: Love this place!! Wish we could have stayed longer. The love Wildlife SOS has for the animals is apparent. This place is the real deal and would love to visit and support them again.

title: Amazing day
review: Spent the day helping with the elephants, walking, preparing food, feeding.  So terrible to hear how they were previously treated.  They are so happy now and given so much love by the amazing people that look after them.  Met some great people from around the world.  Would recommend.

title: Great Initiative
review: This was a great initiative and in a place where people may not be as educated about this cruelty. They do need to work in marketing the spot as an attraction/education. They didn't push for a monetary ask. It was more about the education.

title: The Highlight of Our Trip!
review: I took my kids (10 and 13) here for a half day to volunteer with the elephants.  What a wonderful experience.  We walked with the elephants, fed them, and watched them get some medical care.  We were very impressed with the care the elephants got while they were there and wished they could help all the elephants!  We fell in love with the gentle giants even more than before our visit.  It is definitely worth the trip!

title: Life highlight
review: I did a weekend trip to Agar and took a 40 minute detour to the SOS Elephant rescue centre mid morning and spend half a day there- wish it was longer. What an amazing experience and something I will treasure for life. The staff were fantastic and it was privileged to be able to spend time with these amazing animals, feeding, walking them and watching what they staff do to give them the best life possible given the what they have been through. The team do so much for these animals and desperately need support in sharing what they do and in raising funds. If you are in Agra don't rob yourself of an experience that you will take with you for life.

title: Meeting Elephants is a wonderful experience
review: I felt good meeting Pratima, Lakhi, Coconut, Peanut....n other beautiful elephants rescued by your team. You are doing an amazing job.. Just one suggestion... I feel the elephants need a large area for the place they live & also there is need of extending the area where the elephants go for walk..

title: Experience the passion
review: I visited wildlife SOS elephant rescue centre along with my family this weekend via coming back from agra to delhi & was overwhelmed to see the passion & dedication of the team towards these elephants who have faced unfortunate atrocities at the hands of other human beings. There are adult & baby elephants at the centre & have been rescued from circus, temple begging & other such extreme situations but most of them have recovered fully under the love & care of the team(not to miss the younger ones who are really playful). One can stroll,feed elephants in the centre & most importantly give them affection  ..kudos to the team..keep rocking

title: Meet the elephants.
review: Well worth the trip out of agra to bathe and feed elephants. But ask them to arrange a car, as its a bit tricky to find. I was so lucky to get to bathe the elephants as the were not in mating season, and we got to feed them too. Do not wear your favourite clothes as they will probably be ruined. I was wetter than the elephants at the end. ( but i didnt mind one bit )

title: Amazing experience
review: This review is for elephant refuge. Had a surreal time with the elephants at this refuge. Tragic to see and learn how some of these animals were treated prior to the refuge which really solidifies the importance of the work done here. Also really enjoyed meeting a lot of great people working or volunteering at the refuge. A bit difficult to get to from Agra, as many taxis won't know where it is, and the one arranged by the refuge staff is very expensive.

title: Life changing
review: Our day at the elephant sanctuary was one of the highlights of our trip to India. The organisation does wonderful work caring for these beautiful creatures who have been so badly treated. Here they find peace, love and companionship.

title: Wonderful
review: What an a absolutely must visit place whilst in India not far from Agra. See the fantastic work these people are doing to help these magnificent intelligent majestic animals. Made our holiday

title: A must do for any animal lovers
review: About an hour's car journey from the Taj Mahal is this fabulous bear rescue facility which deserves to be in the Lonely Planet guide as a must do for any animal lovers whilst in Agra. We booked for a 3 and a half hour tour so we really got an insight into the work this charity does and we learned so much about the bears and saw them close up, feeding time etc. There are other rescued animals here too (including a camel) but the bears are definitely it's reason for being. We paid 1100 rupees for 2 of us, a car and driver to enter the bird sanctuary, then it was 3500 rupees each for the extended, private tour. It was worth every penny and this was one of the highlights of our 3 week trip to India. The fab lunch they gave us at the end of the tour just capped off a great 50th birthday. We did come away with a few mozzie bites but. to be honest, we should have realised they would be around and taken some repellant. Can't recommend this place highly enough if you love animals, the staff clearly care for the bears like family and we loved every minute of our visit.

title: Educational
review: We went to the bear rescue facility, and after going to the elephant village in Jaipur a few days later, felt like we really should have gone to Wildlide SOS's elephant sanctuary too. It is educational and sheds good light on a problem that I had never heard about. I enjoyed my time there, but it is a little difficult to get to if you don't take a driver / cab there directly.

title: Amazing place, definitely visit!
review: We went to visit the elephant centre just outside of Agra and are so glad we did as the work they do is incredible, the place is amazing and so are the animals. We came for a 2 hour talk and tour and got to feed the elephants which was brilliant, wish we could have come for a full day.

title: Touching day with Elephants
review: Great day if you like animals.

title: such an amazing experience
review: I had a really really great time! Feeding and walking with the elephants is an experience I will remember forever :)

title: Interesting
review: Learned a lot about elephants and other animals living in captivity in India and why it is important to protect them. It's very impressiv to learn about the engagement and the success of the guys working for Wildlife SOS.

title: Wildlife SOS
review: This group is doing important work with little to no government assistance. It is heartwarming to see the care the Elephants are receiving

title: My Indian Trip Highlight
review: I can't even begin to describe what an amazing experience this was.  Hands down this was the highlight of my trip.  We spent a half a day at the elephant sanctuary and I could of spent another day just taking it all in.  The love and compassion that comes from this place is a stark difference from the world of ugliness and hate the elephants came from.  We got the opportunity to walk with the elephants and feed them.   It is something that I will hold with me forever.  There is a small gift shop that you can purchase locally made good.  Thank you Wildlife SOS for who you are and what you do.

title: Unfortunately a necessary organization but a great experience.
review: I've supported SOS Wildlife for years and my visit to their elephant sanctuary in Mathura was the high point of my trip to India. The work that the staff - handlers, keepers, veterinarians, medical staff and others do for elephants in need in India is truly remarkable. The facility is clean and bright and the elephants are very well cared for. As with all things based on charitable ventures, SOS for Wildlife needs support - emotional yes but especially financial - as the dedicated work they do does not come cheaply. Elephants are large animals that have large need - housing, care, food, and medical to name some. They are fundraising to purchase a larger tract of land to enable the rescue of more elephants in need. PLEASE DONATE

title: Very special experience
review: We arranged for a full days volunteering as we wanted to spend as much time with the Elephants as possible. They can arrange return transport for you from Agra but we went on somewhere else and arranged our own.

title: A Highlight of our Trip to India
review: Having read about the appalling treatment many of India's tourist and agricultural elephants are subjected to, we made the decision not to ride an elephant up to the Amber Fort in Jaipur but to instead visit the Wildlife SOS Elephant Conservation and Care Centre about an hour north of Agra.  What a great decision it turned out to be.  We were the only tourists there at the time and got a very informative tour of the facility and its elephants.  All of them have been rescued from various forms of work and many still bare the mental and physical scars of their decades of torture at the hands of humans.  But the centre's staff and elephant keepers are doing their utmost to care for and heal these magnificent creatures and it was a wonderful experience to walk with them, feed them (fodder and fruit) and hear their stories.  Well done Wildlife SOS - education is definitely the way to turn people away from the exploitation of animals like elephants. Make sure you put it on your India itinerary!

title: For bear and bird lovers
review: Nice place at around an hours drive from Agra for nature lovers. Go during winters and u will see a number of migratory birds. There's a bear rescue centre and a big lake where boating can be done. Meet the guys there who take care of the rescued bears and watch a small film made by them. You can also donate old blankets, food stuff, old newspapers, old clothes there for the use of these bears. Buy some wildlife sos logo t-shirt or other stuff from the Sovenier shop and be a pary of this good project. They also have an elephant rescue centre a few miles away.

title: Amazing volunteering experience
review: Working with the elephants and bears and Wildlife SOS was the best experience of our honeymoon.

title: Elephants
review: My visit to the elephant facility was great. I didnt book in advance and just showed up, there was a staff member who was happy to gove me a solo tour. Well run facility with a great goal of helping abused elephants.

title: Absolutly a must!!!
review: One of the best days I spent in India was here. These majestic animals are so gentle and friendly. They do amazing work here and a visit and donation is so worth it for any animal lover.

title: Wonderful experience!
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our day stint at the elephant rescue and rehabilitation facility! It was amazing to be close to the jumbos, feed them and take them for a walk. Wildlife SOS is doing an amazing job and this place is a must visit if you like to have experiences in life. Strongly recommended if you like animals!

title: Amazing elephants
review: I was on an organised trip to India and I did not know about the sanctuary. A lovely couple on the tour had researched the wildlife sanctuary and a group of us went to see the elephants. It was lovely to see them being cared for but also so sad that they are injured. You get to feed them and touch them and it was lovely to see that they are cared for.

title: What an incredible, heartwarming place!
review: Easy to organise a visit, quick to respond to emails and phone calls.

title: Encounters with Elephants
review: We did the two hour trip here, and enjoyed it.  I think that we probably would have enjoyed the half day more, as  the elephants were all in pens, and I think that walking with them would have been the best bit.  The stories are fascinating, and it was fun to feed the elephants.  It brought welcome variety to our holiday, and was a highlight for our teenage daughters

title: Elephants are great.
review: Getting to be close to such large animals was a wonderful experience. We walked with the elephants feeding them along the way, peanuts for fuel. We prepared food, gave them baths and fed them. The staff was helpful in making us feel comfortable and safe around the elephants.

title: Highlight of our 9 day trip to northern India
review: Our visit to the elephant sanctuary in Mathura was the highlight of our trip (9 days in Northern India)!!!

title: Skip the Taj and visit SOS
review: These people are doing incredible work and it was such an amazing experience to interact with the elephants on such an intimate level.

title: Excellent tour
review: Highly recommend visiting the sanctuary to learn about efforts to rescue elephants and see some of the animals. The guides were very engaging and informative.  Must do if visiting Agra.

title: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE
review: Loved our visit to the sanctuary!!

title: For all Animal Lovers
review: I spent a week here in Agra with my partner and worked at both the Elephant and Bear enclosures. We have had the most amazing experiences with both animals and have some of the most unforgettable moments. We made enrichments to keep the animals occupied and helped prepare the fruit and porridge. They showed us little Movies about the lives they previously lived and were rescued from, I litterally cried the whole time. These animals have been through hell for the sake of entertainment and I am now more aware of what I can do to help. Both centres are fantastic to work at and the change they are making in the locals who work there is inspiring. I will definitely be supporting these guys long term. Volunteering here has been a pleasure and I would recommend it to everyone. Thanks Wildlife SOS for the amazing memories.

title: nature <3
review: if you are of a person who loves nature and just simply love wildlife then this is a must visit place in agra.

title: Incredible experience!
review: I visited the Wildlife SOS Elephant Conservation and Care Center on a World Challenge school trip and it was one of the highlights of my time in India! It was so much fun spending time with the elephants and very interesting learning about each of their lives. The people there are doing amazing things for the animals they care for and I am definitely wanting to volunteer in the future! Such an incredible experience that I will never forget, there is nothing like walking next to a giant gentle elephant.

title: Loved it
review: We had a great day at ECC with my children and parents . It is a low key place that does great work and the team is sincere . Worth the visit to interact with the elephants .

title: Amazing experience with compassionate and caring workers
review: My boyfriend and I went to visit the sanctuary in late November. Our guide was excellent at explaining the work the sanctuary does and the background story of each of the elephants. The elephants were in amazing conditions which was a great change from what we saw in touristy areas. The workers treated the elephants with love and compassion and you can tell that they love their job! On our tour we were able to pet and feed the elephants (those that were in better shape and had been with the sanctuary for a longer period). I would highly recommend making a visit to this sanctuary while in India, not only for the personal experience, but also to support a great cause.

title: Volunteered in December
review: I had an amazing experience as a volunteer at the Agra Bear Rescue Facility as well as the Elephant rescue facility from 12th Dec to 17th Dec. We volunteers were treated well by the staff and we were given a good orientation at both the centers on the first day by Madhumita, the Education Officer. I had good fun going for walks with the elephants, chopping fruits and vegetables for the animals and feeding them, making play enrichments for them and cleaning their enclosures. All in all, it was a wonderful learning experience. I do plan to volunteer again in a couple of years time.

title: Fantastic work #WildlifeSOS
review: Thank you for a wonderful visit. Great to hear about the work you're doing now and plan to do in future. Loved seeing the elephants.

title: Meaningful and wonderful experience
review: Would definitely recommend a visit to this place. I spent a month in India and this is still an experience that comes top of mind when I think about what I would do again if I were to visit India again. Only issue is that it is a bit hard to get to the reserve...would recommend booking a private driver that is able to stay with your group the whole day and make the trip.

title: Don't miss it
review: So interesting and nice to hear some good news stories. The bears need your help and it is so nice to see that you can support them. The tour is good, the guides knowledgable and caring and it's for a good cause. Win win. Not hard to get to either - take a cab. There is also more than bears. There are wild deer, monkeys and cute puppies. Well worth a visit while in Agra.

title: Elephant's
review: Worth the drive yo get too. Out if the way and small but the staff was friendly. Learned a lot about captive elephants. Budget for a hour.

title: Great experience
review: We throughly enjoyed our visit to the elephant rescue centre in Agra.  It it very well set up and the stories of the elephants were heartbreaking but it was so awesome to see how well they are being looked after now.  A great experience that we would highly recommend others add to their Agra itinerary.  You simply email the centre to request a visit, the process was easy and straightforward.  They had great facilities  (ie. the toilets were great!).

title: Elephant sos
review: Was amazig experience and what a great job they do for the animals.  Sad to see

title: Wildlife SOS Agra
review: We had an amazing few hours with these people. I suggest you book in advance, we didn't realise and just turned up!

title: The best stop of the whole trip
review: I think it's of the highest importance to support this group. The work is real, they really care about the animals and need our help to continue doing the work.

title: Wonderful learning experience!
review: Thank you for a wonderful visit to the Wildlife SOS center! Our group really enjoyed our visit and learned so much. The elephants' stories are amazing. Keep up the great, life-changing work!

title: Wonderful experience
review: To see the elephants being cared for and having the freedom was uplifting.

title: Wonderful Experience at Elephant Rescue Center!
review: My husband and I visited the Elephant Rescue Center in November 2016.  We had a really fantastic experience.  We came in the afternoon, during snack time.  We were walked around and introduced to all of the female elephants.  We heard their life stories and how they ended up at the center.  We were able to feed some of the elephants sugarcane and bananas and pet them.  They were all so sweet and a few of them were mischievous. :)  I would definitely recommend the Wildlife SOS to fellow travelers.  It's a great experience and a great cause!

title: Elephant Sanctuary Visit, Agra
review: Great opportunity for a close encounter with these gentle giants and also learn all about them. It is advisable to call and make an appointment to visit. They allowed us to help bathe and feed them and answered all our questions. We were also shown a video to help us understand why the sanctuary is needed. Certainly made me think about how the elephants are treated.

title: Trip to the Elephant Sanctuary, Matura
review: Mum and I visited the Elephant Sanctuary in November while we were touring India. Thank you for allowing us to meet all the female elephants and sharing their stories. It was wonderful to see the good work done by Wildlife SOS staff and volunteers. Definitely hope to meet Raju and visit the Agra Bear Sanctuary next time.

title: Worthwhile Organization
review: We stopped by for a short visit and got to meet "the girls"--the rescued female elephants. The males were is musth, so were in a separate, more secure location. Many of the rescued elephants need ongoing medical treatment. Each elephant has her name and story on a poster near her stall. The elephants are in social groupings, one "lady" in each group being the matriarch--not necessarily the eldest. Elephants eat a LOT and require quite a lot of care, so the organization needs donations to continue their mammoth task. The sanctuary was a bit difficult to find, but I'm glad we visited it. The elephants are photogenic, each with her own personality. The guide was very good.

title: An amazing organization that does wonderful work and welcomes your visit
review: Wildlife SOS is doing absolutely amazing work rescuing Sloth Bears and Elephants from tortured lives in captivity (begging, entertaining, giving rides, etc.), and providing them with healthcare and freedom to exist in peace.

title: amazing experience!!
review: We liked to know this project and see the work they do with these animals. It was a lovely experience to be able to walk alongside them in complete freedom. Know that there are people committed to this cause and fight every day so that they are not mistreated. Enjoy the animals in freedom!

title: LeapNow gap-year program visits WSOS
review: This place was very comfortable and the work they are doing with the animals is very important. We are a group of students in a gap year program - learning about culture and religion while doing service around India.

title: Elephant Sanctuary
review: Roughly 40 km from Taj Mahal, there is an elephant rescue facility worth visiting.  They also have a bear sanctuary but we only went to the elephant one.  You will have a chance to walk with the elephants (must get there by 830a), bathe and feed the elephants and get a history of why such a sanctuary is necessary in India.  There is so much love for the elephants here.  We were there with our 7 year old daughter and she had a tremendous experience.  Your entrance fee includes a lunch.  I absolutely recommend this excursion.

title: One of the best things I've done in my life!
review: Do not miss going to the Wildlife SOS, It is absolutely worthwhile. Learning about these giant humble beauties and getting a chance to bathe them and feed them is absolutely amazing. The people at Wildlife SOS rescue elephants from cruelty and exploitation, they give their time and love to these animals so they can know a better life. They depend on voluntary donations to survive, so your visit is very important. You will leave this place with a heart full of love and happiness as well as the knowledge to do what is right for all animals.

title: A Truly Amazing Experience
review: Spending a week as a volunteer at Wildlife SOS was an absolutely amazing experience.   The majority of our time was spent at the elephant centre; walking, bathing and feeding them.  Being given the opportunity to have contact with the elephants and learn so much about these gentle giants, and getting to know their individual personalities, was a pure privilege.

title: A must see in India!
review: Did this as a part of a school study trip and loved the experience. It's definitely a must see and a cause worthy of support. The guides are very knowledgable about conservation and explain the history of the animals in the sanctuary and the challenges associated with running the organization. It helps you view elephants in and around India in a different light and makes you think about what kind of tourism you support. The elephants looked majestic and happy in the environment. Although we didn't have much time to spend we treasured every minute of it!

title: A worthwhile alternative to conventional sightseeing near Agra
review: Our group of 5 thoroughly enjoyed this 2 hour side trip to the Elephant Conservation Center near Agra. We learned about the ongoing challenges to improving the living and working conditions for elephants in India.

title: Tend with love
review: There are many who follow the phrase "live to love, love to live". And then there are few who actually work beyond such phrases not only they "live to love but love to give life with love". And one such place exists in the middle of agra and mathru highway where they not only protect the injured animal but also tend them with love. It's here where you actually realize what it is to be free.

title: Heart warming
review: Lovely to walk around and meet all the elephants and hear their stories, and see them so happy.

title: Wildlife SOS volunteer
review: What an incredible experience! Just being able to help out and meet so many wonderful people who are thanking such good care of these elephants is incredible.

title: An amazing 4 weeks volunteering
review: As part of a group of 8 students I volunteered for 4 weeks with Wsos. We alternated between their bear facility in Agra and with the elephants in Mathura. When we weren't working we were staying in their volunteer house (which had wifi, a kitchen and many different rooms) about 20 minutes from the Wsos facilities. Our month in India was amazing thanks to the incredible staff there.

title: LOVE,LIFE  AND  ELEPHANTS
review: WSOS is  a great placeto visit  and to   help with all aspects  of  daily  care  for the  Elephants.   The  Elephants  are all  rescued  from the   cruel  tourist / temple  trade.  All have  sufferd  prolonged  agony  and  hardship  for many  years. Some  for  over  half  a  century.

title: Fantastic Experience
review: We had an absolutely brilliant day with the Elephants on our trip in October 2016. The whole setup is fantastic and the work that these guys are doing to rescue these elephants is truly outstanding.

title: Humane way to see India's animals
review: This sanctuary is absolutely incredible.  The dedicated individuals that work here work around the clock to give their rescued animals the best life possible!

title: Fantastic experience
review: While in Agra we took some time to visit the Elephant Sanctuary in Mathura. It was a wonderful experience and provided much needed education on the lives of working elephants.  Definitely worth a visit and preferably before you visit the Amber Fort in Jaipur so you won't be tempted to ride the elephants there.

title: A loving peaceful sanctuary for these beautiful elephants
review: An amazing place with fantastic caring volunteers who care and love these majestic animals who have had shocking experiences and now can finally enjoy their  retirement years. I highly recommend this place. To hear some of their stories will get you to tears, but to know they are safe and happy is such a joy.

title: A must visit
review: These guys are doing an amazing job under challenging circumstances. A definite must see and spread the word of the incredible work these guys are doing so that the elephants will not suffer and by bringing school children to see this sanctuary it will change the way we view these magnificent beasts.

title: AWESOME EXPERIENCE
review: Amazing community of elephant-care volunteers. Makes you think a lot about the things we can change. Thx for great job you are doing there. Thumbs up

title: An inspiring place to visit.
review: Truly an incredible place. The work being done here is inspiring. What a treat to meet and hear the stories of these elephants. Highly recommend for all animal lovers.

title: ELEPHANT AND SLOTH BEAR SANCTUARY
review: So enjoyed visit to elephant sanctuary. Gained huge insight into these loving gentle giants. All have been rescued from cruelty, such as ill treatment in circuses. Now they're having the sort of life they deserve. Volunteers who give their time free to love and care for these amazing creatures. You can see them bathed and fed. Hear them crack the sugar cane. This is an experience not to be missed.

title: A rare privilege
review: Make sure you take the time to visit this special place and learn more about conserving India's elephants while spending time with these amazing creatures.

title: Highlight of India trip
review: Wildlife SOS was one of the most worthwhile places we have ever visited.  It was wonderful to hear the stories of the elephants and to see them on the road to being well.   It was an eye opener to watch the video on the bears.   Its frightening to think of the cruelty to animals, but its wonderful to see the work of the SOS team.

title: Well maintained facility but TripAdvisor misleading
review: This facility is clearly doing incredible work for rehabilitating sloth bears.  We were guided around a small section of the facility by a non-English speaking security guard - including an informational video the whole trip took about 20 minutes.  We went there expecting to see elephants, as the TripAdvisor photos lead you to believe,  but there are no elephants there.  We also paid 500 rupees per person at the entrance, when the sign only says 150 rupees per person.  Not sure if the guard pocketed the extra or the sign needs to be updated.

title: Bear and elephant rescue facility / sanctuary
review: Must see. The stories of how these wonderful animals have been treated is gut wrenching. The facility is well maintained and staff knowledgeable and friendly.

title: so comforting watch rescued bears
review: visit to bear rescue facility in Agra is a good sight seeing option that also gives a sense of comfort.
