Soor sarovar and birds are soothing to otherwise dry stone sites. bears were adorable when they went to lick the honey offered by the caretaker. presentation by wildlife SOS team was informative and educative. felt proud on thier efforts in saving wildlife, especially endangered species

title: Visit to Elephant Sanctuary in Mathura
review: A friend and I visited the Elephant Sanctuary in Mathura (near Agra) for a full day tour with the elephants. Our taxi driver was confused and first took us to the Sloth Bear location so a staff member there gave us a quick walk around the property to see a few bears before we continued on to the Elephant Sanctuary. I would recommend having your driver call to make sure you go to the right location and avoid this confusion, but I did enjoy seeing the bears. Once at the elephant sanctuary we were taken by our guide to join the morning walk of 3 of their rescued elephants. We then joined some volunteers in cutting up their morning fruit and feeding them as well as helping bathe several of the elephants. I did not realize how close we would be allowed to get to the elephants and my friend and I were very happy with the experience. We had plenty of time to interact and take photos. If you do the full day tour, you then return to the office and are given lunch and shown a video about their work. It is a wonderful organization and after following them on Facebook for a few years it was exciting to see some of the elephants I had read about living such a peaceful, happy life. If you love elephants, you will love this experience.

title: Delightful elephants
review: On a visit to india We went to the wildlife sanctuary to meet the elephants that have been rescued form their deportable lives .

title: Wonderful Experience - Not an Attraction; More a Sanctuary
review: Spent 4 days visiting and helping out at the Elephant Conservation Center and 1/2 day at the Sloth Bear Sanctuary.  Days started by walking with the female elephants, cutting fruit for them, washing them, feeding them and just plain watching them.  Visited the males while they receive their daily medical treatments - wounds are horrific.  Visited the bears and heard their horrific past.  On Bear Island there are so many beautiful animals and on the boat ride over so many different birds.  One day no more animal rides and entertainment and abuse.  Let them be and let them enjoy life.  Planning on returning in 2018.

title: Great vist!
review: Me and a group of friends got the amazing chance to visit Wildlife SOS. We learned a lot about how the elephants were being treated very poorly and how SOS saved them. The staff was very friendly and we got the chance to feed and pet the elephants. This is a great place and they are doing great things to save these animals. If you get the chance to visit or even volunteer please do so.

title: GREAT !!!
review: This visit of elephants and people who care about their a help was really fantastic. Before visit I have read some informations and articles on web...for example about Rasha ...elephant who cryed when was saved ...tears was also on my face...I love this big animals, their good eyes ... this emotional, loved one meeting. God bless their work and care ...I think that they  was really with love made ....

title: Loved the elephants and the staff behaviour.
review: One of the best facilities for animals in need I have ever seen. Though I had visited Agra many time, I did not know about the facility. They really take care of the animals, who were looking well fed and happy.

title: Dream Trip
review: Wildlife sos is a place if you love and empathise the abuse asian elephants suffer..its a place where you can go and volunteer and work with these gorgeous elephants, walk with them on the morning walks bathe them and chop up there fruit and veg for meal times, anf feel as if you are doing something to help!! A wonderful experience and i hope to return soon

title: Truly Inspiration!!
review: My partner and I had the most wonderful day volunteering at Wildlife SOS. We stayed in the guest house the night before and met some of the most wonderful and caring people. The stories of the elephants were devastating so to see the amazing work these wildlife warriors are doing is truly inspiration. It is truly a testament to the amazing staff that work there. We would recommend everyone to take part it in!

title: An Elephant Education
review: If you are prepared to undertake the challenge of finding the center, you will be rewarded with a memorial elephant experience. There is nothing commercial or sophisticated about the facilities but is all the more charming for it. There is a metal portacabin where you will watch an informative video, purchase t-shirts and grab a drink of water. Afterwards you will visit the stars of the day, the elephants. You can not help but be moved by their sad stories and feel their joy of sanctuary and freedom. We had 5 children with us - age 10 to 14 years. Whilst they loved feeding the elephants, the younger children did find the amount of information a little overwhelming. My only negative comment was that we felt it was quiet expensive for a family of 4. About £25.

title: Amazing last place resting facility for the dancing bears
review: The Wildlife SOS runs this amazing centre for rescued sloth bears. Baby bears who have been stolen from their families are cruelly made to perform for earning money by banjara families. This organisation gets them to hand over the bears who are then taken care of in this facility. The banjara families are given Rs 50,000 for the bear, helped to take up a livelihood and their children educated. This organisation is doing a great job.

title: Wonderful place Wonderful work
review: We spent the day with Kana Ram from India Authentic Tour on the 14th of October at the centre and it was one of the best days of our holidays in India. Wonderful place, elephants and people. Please do visit the rescue centre and learn about the hard time the poor elephants have on the hands of some people. A must do in India

title: Fun &  important
review: Thankyou for the oppertunity to have a short Look and to hear about the amazing job You are doing at the elefant rescue centre rescuing them from captivity

title: Incredible experience
review: We volunteered here for a week at the end of our holiday and had the most incredible time.  The team at Wildlife SOS are doing really important work, and we felt very privileged to have the opportunity to help look after the elephants and the bears.  We met some wonderful animals, some wonderful people, and really enjoyed our stay.

title: Excellent But Heart Wrenching
review: Wildlife SOS needs to given kudos for their job of managing the elephants. Most of the elephants have had a traumatic life and this organization tries to alleviate it. No fanfare and just action. Went there unannounced and to my surprise the place looked so serene and peaceful with these gentle creatures being unto themselves. I believe there are opportunities to spend an entire day with the elephants but that requires prior bookings.

title: Elephant sanctuary
review: Lovely place to see and care for elephants up, close and personal. The team there is lovely and engaged. Would highly recommend for families travelling to Agra

title: Incredible & Must See
review: There are 2 facilities. One for the Sloth Bear & another for Elephants. One must take time to visit these.

title: An emotional and positive experience!
review: What passionate and beautiful people we met at the elephant rescue centre. Not to mention the elephants. This is a wonderful place to learn and see first hand the harm (in the past) and the caring (currently) humans do/give to these animals. Our 2 hours spent there was heart wrenching and inspiring. We loved it and are looking for ways to promote and support this cause from now on... absolutely love your work wildlife sos!!!

title: Brilliant
review: My daughter and i spent an incredible week with wildlife SOS....as i am 60 and  have arthritis i was worried in case i wouldnt be able to do much "volunteering" the staff were absolutely amazing.....i did what i could and had a wonderful time....really was a holiday to remember...Thank you

title: Best place for you and for the elephants
review: I did a short visit with a tour around the facility, meet & greet with every elephant and feeding the elephants. The elephants are treated very well at this place. They aren't chained and the volunteers don't use painfull tools on the elephants. You can see that the elephants are happy and they are very friendly. I could pet every elephants and I got a picture taken with an elephant standing next to it. If you're thinking about visiting an elephant sanctuary, this is the place you should go to. On of the few places where it's about the elephants, not te pleasure of the tourists and you still can have a great experience. 5/5 for me, they really need the support from visitors, because they have to pay for everything themselfs. The guide was also very good, he knew the story about every elephant and took the time to get to know every elephant!

title: Enlightenment to elephants
review: Fabulous visit - my husband and I learnt so much about elephants. The staff were so knowledgeable. So sad though to hear the plight of these wonderful animals. Both the western world and people from India need to have a greater insight into what this centre has to offer.

title: Awesome experience
review: We really enjoyed our visit and it was great to see that there are facilities for elephants to recover from abuse. I was very impressed with our guide who obviously loved the elephants and was a great advocate for them.  We will never support any elephant activities in the future that involve riding elephants, circuses or temples with elephants and would encourage other people to avoid these activities too.  It was rather shocking to learn about how terrible the lives of many elephants are and how they are subjected to such abuse under the eyes of so many people. It should be a national shame. I think this place is a very good facility to support and I would encourage other tourists to visit it.  The 1500 r entrance fee is justified. Each elephant eats 200 kgs a day (4000 r cost) and the feeding and staffing costs of such a facility would be considerable.

title: Elephant refuge
review: What a great experience. You also learned about the animals individual situations and what can go on behind the scenes of the elephant based attractions. Loved meeting these beauties and watching them interact.

title: Excellent facility for the deprived
review: They take care of the deprived animals like human beings..

title: Great place doing great work
review: The Wildlife SOS people are extremely passionate about the great work they are doing and it shows when they take you around their facility. If you want to get up close and personal with happy, well treated elephants this is the place to go. You can feed them and bathe them while the staff tell you all about how they were rescued and how they have recovered. Definitely worth the ~30-45min drive from Agra.

title: A fun and informative stay.
review: I was the individual in my group who didn't want to participate in the 7 hour tour but I was pleasantly surprised by the elephants! Even though they've mostly been abused before they came to the shelter, they seem remarkably well adjusted. I would definitely go again, even if just for the free sugar biscuits.

title: Amazing Experience
review: It was one of the most touching and genuine experiences I have had in India till date. The stuff these guys are doing and the passion they do it with is incredible.

title: Amazing organization!
review: What a wonderful place! They've helped so many elephants and it was amazing to see elephants not used for other means and at a safe place. Happy this place exists for the elephants in India  Very informative and we got to cut up fruit for feeding.

title: Best experience!!!!
review: To be able to be face to face with these wonderfull creatures is a lifetime experience. Seeing how these elephants that were so abused and mistreated are now in the most loving and caring place for them is beyond moving. The staff is wonderfull and spend a lot of time educating you and explaining each animals plight. We were in India for 13 days and by far the best experience we had. Don't think about it just go. You will a better person for doing so.

title: COMPASSION
review: Having visited the Wildlife SOS sanctuary a few weeks ago, I was touched by the shear compassion and empathy shown to the beautiful animals which are cared for. It gave me real hope to see that volunteers flood here and pay for the privilege of helping with the daily feeding and bathing. I would recommend this sanctuary to any visitors who have a regard for wildlife and want see just how much good is being done at this wonderful haven for abused animals. Long may the Wildlife SOS sanctuary be supported!

title: Best experience of my life 🐘
review: I have just spent one week volunteering for Wildlife SOS. The best experience of our lives! From the moment we arrived we were greeted by Bheema education officer.He made us feel so welcomed explained everything to us. We spent the week at both facilities. Walking,bathing and feeding the elephants. Watching them was truly amazing, Seeing them being there selves and most importantly "Free" the mahouts and carers have done amazing job, They are so loving and affection towards them, You can clearly see the bonds they have formed.

title: Amazing
review: This was such an amazing experience ,

title: Amazing Experience
review: We were fortunate to book a visit to Wildlife SOS with India Authentic Tours. It was a once in a lifetime opportunity to see elephants in a natural environment.

title: A beautiful experience
review: Seeing how these lovely elephants that were abused and exploit by their owners are in a much better place now was amazing! It was so beautiful to see how they have lots of food, love, fun, health and long walks - things they have never experienced before coming to S.O.S Wildlife! This is a place where they really care about the animals! A place with pure love. Breathtaking. And definitely worth a visit - or if you have time to volunteer, I would say; do it!

title: Agra Elephant Care and Conservation Trip
review: We visited the elephants at Wildlife SOS in Agra. We honestly had the best time. It is such an amazing place to visit. The elephants are well looked after and the education officers at full of helpful information. It was so nice to see the animals happy and in a more natural environment. Feeding and washing an elephant, a day we'll never forget.

title: A dream come true
review: From the moment my friends and I arrived at the sanctuary we knew we had made the right decision to go there. We were warmly welcomed by one of the officers who explained to us that we had arrived right on time to join two of the female elephants on their morning walk. The team worked hard to ensure we felt safe around the elephants and knew how to behave around them to ensure both us and the elephants were comfortable. The officer (I wish i got his name as he was excellent) was clearly very well informed about elephants and the way to best care for them. I was touched by the compassion and care demonstrated by the team at wildlife SOS. Out of all the places we visited in Agra, including the Taj Mahal, for me this experience topped all of them. Thank you to wildlife SOS for the work they are doing for those rescued elephants in Agra. I would recommend this place 100%, I would love to visit again.

title: An amazing day with Elephants.
review: Fantastic hand on experience with these magnificent animals... time well spent understanding the issues surrounding the maltreatment of these bears and elephants.. the sanctuary goes some way to redressing the damage.. and giving some quality back to these unfortunate victims lives.

title: A must visit
review: I have been a regular at the Wildlife SOS Bear rescue center at Bangalore and am happy that both these are a perfect fit for what is required for the rescue and rehabilitation of the Sloth Bears . I will keep going back

title: Wildlife SOS
review: Wildlife SOS,

title: Spend a few hours with incredible elephants and their lovely carers
review: Went to the elephant sanctuary on the way to the Taj in Agra. It is only 30 km before the Taj from Delhi and 100% worth a visit. A great opportunity to enjoy interacting with animals without the guilt of adding to their mistreatment. Thank you to everyone working at the sanctuary for your incredible work.

title: Sloth Bears!
review: We went on our last day to visit the bears. Its a beautiful place and if you are into nature this is a place to visit. The stories are sad but it is interesting to hear how people once earned their money. My only wish is that we had more time there. The entrance fee is 1500 rupees but you need to pay an additional 500 rupees to enter the jungle that the wildlife reserve is in.

title: Brilliant
review: It was so amazing so see such beautiful creatures being taken care of so well. The guide was very informative and he knew every elephant by name and by nature, completely. We were able to feed the elephants bananas and the gift shop was great too. It was so awful to hear about the traumas these elephants went through before they arrived at the facility, but fortunately they are very happy elephants now. It ended our three week trip in India perfectly. Thank you!

title: Great Work
review: Please visit this site to support the great work they do for the rescue bears. Be aware the ticket you buy at the first gate gets you into the park area, there is an extra 1500 rupee fee to get a guided tour though the bear park. It is worth it to see how this organization helps with no govt sponsorship.

title: Amazing work - keep it up!
review: We went to the Bear Rescue facility just outside of Agra on our visit to India, just to see something a bit different. The work that they do is amazing! The tour was very educational. It is so sad to see how the dancing bears have been treated in the past, and what they have endured. This facility does so much to raise awareness in the communities and to improve outcomes for people who were previously using the bears for profit.

title: Best animal experience ever
review: What a pleasure to spend even just a few hours at Wildlife SOS.

title: There are two wildlife SOS'
review: Around Agra there are two wildlife SOS centres. One is for Elephants and the other for bears. I visited the bear SOS centre also called Sur Sarovar bird sanctuary.

title: Beautiful place doing amazing work!
review: would highly recommend! Look after the animals well and treat them with kindness and respect- had an excellent morning with the elephants and afternoon with the bears!!

title: An unforgettable experience that warms your heart.
review: This rescue center is amazing, the work they do is very heart warming and inspiring. They rescue elephants from difficult backgrounds and try to provide them with the care and love they need. The elephants get daily vet check ups and the elephant caretakers make sure that all of the elephants' needs are well taken care of.

title: A Blessed Experience
review: Our humanitarian teams (faculty and students) working in India visited Wildlife SOS. Never did I imagine that I would meet Rhea, Sita and Mia - rescued sister elephants who I supported and prayed for their release from Facebook notices. It was a blessing to see that "captives were set free". I also saw that this rescue work is genuine and effective. Although in the US, we are a rescue bird family - I now feel a kinship to these rescued elephants. Dr Erwin

title: Such a wonderful place!
review: We went to the elephant rescue center in Matura and we loved to see how the elephants were taken care of. The tour was very interesting and our guide told us passionately about the work he does. This organization does such good work!!

title: Elephant Conservation
review: We went to the elephant conservation centre. We're educated on the awful treatment that elephants get all over India to drive revenue from tourists and how he centre started to rescue these elephants and help them heal. We walked up to each of the elephant groups in the park and those who were calm we could touch. We then went and prepared the elephants lunch with some volunteers from the UK. Cutting up a lot of corn, Mellon and pumpkin. Then we helped the volunteers and workers wash the elephants, which the elephants seemed to enjoy in the heat, from there we fed the elephants. During the day Shiva (probably spelled wrong) explained so much about the elephants and what they are doing and how far they have to go to make continue their work. It was then finished off with a lunch with the volunteers. Great experience highly recommended! Especially for animal lovers.

title: Hidden gem
review: Added this at the last minute to our agra/mathura trip. It turned out to be the highlight of out trip to the area. It opened our eyes to the cruelty the Bears and Elephants face. Hats off to the amazing work of the volunteers and the workers. Very heartening and inspiring to the see their dedication. After this trip we were decided to visit their Bannerghatta center near bangalore as well which has bears and some tigers. You will never see elephants in the cities and temples the same way again after you visit this facility. A total eye opener!

title: Great time at Wildlife SOS
review: It felt great to be really making a difference in the lives of these animals. The video of their previous conditions made me cry, but made me even more passionate about bettering the lives of the animals. Wildlife SOS is making a huge difference, and they make the work  fun, so join them for a great trip!

title: Beautiful experience
review: Friendly guide, got to hear about how the elephants were rescued and how they are looked after and got to wash and feed them which was lovely!

title: Highlight of our time in India
review: I have followed Wildlife SOS's work for years from a distance, and so was thrilled to have the chance to visit the Elephant Care and Conservation Center in Mathura. The center is about a 45 min drive from central Agra, and so I would recommend arranging a taxi through your hotel. The visit to the center was one of the highlights of my time in India. It is so impactful to see people working tirelessly to rehabilitate these elephants. Walking with the elephants was amazing, they are such beautiful and sensitive creatures. As someone who cares deeply about elephants and conservation, this was a rare opportunity to interact in a meaningful way with these animals. The keepers and volunteers at the center are truly inspiring and it was a privilege to visit and support their work. Even if you are not able to visit, I encourage you to subscribe to Wildlife SOS's newsletter and support their work in any way you can.

title: Negative
review: Having previously visited the elephant sanctuary which was spacious and somewhat a natural environment, was saddened by the small cages and cramped conditions which the Bears had to endure.

title: An unforgettable experience
review: I learned a lot and loved everything they were doing on the reserve. It was great to spend time with such amazing animals and inspiring people who are truly dedicated to what they do. I would highly recommend to everyone. It is very eye-opening and provides a lot of perspective on what is really important in life.

title: Owsome visit
review: It was a great visit to see agra kitam vihar and specially to see the bears rescued by sos.they are in large numbers and in good health playing with ball.Everyone must see the owsome place.

title: Amazing Place
review: In July of 2016 I travelled to India with a teen travel company called Rustic Pathways. For our time in India we worked at Wildlife SOS's Agra Bear Facility and Mathura Elephant Center. The staff was extremely nice and were so dedicated to the companies cause. Every animal and person at Wildlife SOS had an amazing story and it was incredible to see the work they were doing. We also stayed at their volunteer house which was very clean and accommodating. Overall I had a life changing experience with beautiful animals and amazing people at Wildlife SOS. I would recommend everyone should visit Wildlife SOS because of the incredible work they do for animals and people across India!

title: Volunteering was amazing
review: The accomodations where lovely and the experience one I will never forget. It is hard work but it gives you a taste of what this place is all about. Roll up your sleeves and get to work you won't regret it. Meals are the fairly the same each day but the food was good! I arranged for them to pick me up from Agra, it might be a bit tricky to get there other wise :)

title: Stunning experience
review: Amazing staff, and the care they take for the elephants is amazing, the heartbreaking stories are juxtaposed with the happiness the elephants now have !! Amazing interactive experience and a once in a lifetime opportunity

title: Knowledgeable trip
review: The trip was a good experience providing as knowledge and also encouraging us to be more aware of our environment.

title: Wonderful Experience
review: My experience at Wildlife SOS was wonderful. The workers were very insightful, and educated all of us students very well. We had lots of fun feeding and bathing the elephants.

title: Amazing
review: I visited Wildlife SOS during my 2 day stay in Agra as part of World Challenge. We all had the most amazing time, and regret only going for the 2 hour experience. We got to feed the elephants and even get inside the enclosure with them. We got to know information about each elephant, and their story as to how to came to Wildlife SOS.

title: Wildlife sos
review: This organisation does very good work in a thorough way. It's certainly worth a visit, not only because your visit supports a good cause but also because it's very interesting and informative.

title: Great experience!
review: I had the best day of my life, the work that the sanctuary do is amazing. We went for the 7 hour all day visit and it's well worth the money. To get so close to the elephants and be able to bathe and feed them was such a great experience and I can't rate it highly enough :) I hope to go back in the future.

title: Wildlife SOS Review
review: What this company do for these amazing animals is incredible! So inspiring and definitely recommended!

title: Amazing!!!!
review: Overall amazing! everyone is friendly and nice and the animals are beautiful and I will come visit again for sure!

title: Amazing time!
review: We went on the 7 hour excursion, had the time of ours lives! walked in the fields with the elephants and got amazingly close, got the chance to hand feed and bathe the elephants, overall had a brilliant time.

title: Elephant Rescue a trip Highlight
review: Had a great time seeing, feeding and enjoying Elephants rescued and being taken care of in a great facility

title: Easily the Best Thing You'll Do Visiting India
review: My partner and I elected to spend one full Volunteer Day with Wildlife SOS including staying overnight the night prior. The accommodations are comfortable even in the summer and our hostess' food was theBOMB.com.

title: Fantastic!
review: I volunteered at Wildlife SOS for 2 weeks and had an amazing time. The people who work there really love animals and they are doing such a great job for the elephants and the bears. Bheema, Madhumitha and Shivam was amazing and took care of me for 2 weeks and did my visit wonderful. Thank you Wildlife sos for saving Indias animals. I think everyone should visit and help them!

title: The best day we had in india
review: It was such a wonderful day and so inspiring to see lovely people truly helping animals. I would recommend this to anyone in the Agra area

title: Fantastic experience
review: What a fantastic experience, wonderful people and so great to hear all of the stories, we now recommend it to all of our clients!

title: If you love elephants...
review: Nice to see our elephants friends being well taken care of and happy after years of horrific abuse...

title: A day spent with sloth bears and elephants
review: I think the sheer fact that these two sanctuaries exist, is a great thing. The sloth bears and elephants are well-looked after and above that, are genuinely loved and cared for. I do hope more people choose to volunteer and visit and contribute to its upkeep, in whatever way possible. My friend and I had a wonderful, wonderful time. I wish Wildlife SOS the very best and hope to visit again soon!

title: Very good to see the sursarovar
review: it is wonderful to watch the blinds person kuti they are living there with their dignity further bear rescue park is amazing. Yamuna view is most beautiful attraction.

title: Great experience
review: It was a great experience to visit to such a place and been able to look the bears so closely and also the people over there are great.

title: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE
review: To visit the rescued Bears and Elephants was a wonderful experience.  To see the care these animals get now and to see them happy and playful finally after their life of cruelty is very heartwarming.  The people who run SOS are such caring and loving individuals towards these wonderful animals. I would highly recommend a visit.

title: Enjoy a lot with jumbo's
review: Instead of wasting money in junk food nd other thing we all frnds did contree nd take food to our new frnds jumbo's where we enjoy a lot by giving them food nd also we give bath to them. Thank u sos for giving us good experience nd we will continue this in future also

title: Excellent!
review: We were indeed honoured to have been given the opportunity to serve this great organisation. They are doing a great job towards animal conservation and we were glad to be a part of it. :))

title: Amazing learning experience
review: At Wildlife SOS not only did I interact with some of the unbelievable and dedicated people I have ever met, I also insteracted with some amazing animals. The care the goes into these animals is remarkable. Wildlife SOS really makes a difference in the world.

title: A different world altogether :)
review: I conquered my fears, I felt utmost joy looking at the animals eat what I put into their plates or buckets. The only thing that kept me going in this trip was the sympathy I had for the animals. This trip truly changed a major part in me. Whomsoever has a chance of going to Agra do spend time in Wildlife SOS it is an amazing experience, on you will not forget.

title: Lovely elephants, less lovely miscommunication
review: Visiting the elephants was very enjoyable and rewarding - we were, in fact, late and they delayed the elephants' walk for us, which I felt guilty about it.

title: HELP SAVE THE PRECIOUS 4
review: Wildlife SOS carried out a daring rescue in May of 4 elephants from the Rambo Circus. These elephants had been abused, were injured and 1 of them is blind, but were still forced to work Since May these elephants have been receiving much need medical care, nutrition and love from the WildlifeSOS Team  Now Wildlife SOS have been orderedto send thembackto a life of chains, abuse and forced labour  This action is so cruel and cannot be tolerated  Please sign their petition as they need asmany signatures as possible -spread the word

title: PrasadFamily
review: A fantastic effort and selfless service to animals. Hats off to the dedication and focus at the wellbeing of elephants who have had a traumatized past. Enrichment centre et al. Awesome initiative.

title: Our best Indian Experience
review: We visited with our kids aged 12 and 14 as part of a 2 week tour of Rajestan and this was the highlight after the Taj Mahal. Far, far better than the commercial elephant parks like Elefantastic and significantly cheaper. The elephants are rescued from circuses and the like. They have 16 currently. We fed them, washed them and walked with them. Fantastic animals and really well kept. They even emailed photos to us. They also keep rescued bears in another similar sanctuary close by. Highly recommended

title: Great Way to Learn About Elephants in a Respectful and Responsible Environment
review: Seeing elephants during my time in India was a priority for me, but I did not want to participate in exploitative practices. Wildlife SOS gave me the opportunity to wash, feed, and walk alongside elephants that had been rescued from circuses and other horrible circumstances. The staff were extremely knowledgeable and their passion for animal welfare was apparent. I would recommend bringing a change of clothes, a water bottle, clothes you don't mind getting dirty, and a camera. I would also highly recommend the full day pass over the 2 hour pass. The only thing my partner struggled with was the heat during the walk, so make sure to stay hydrated and bring a hat! I am so happy we chose Wildlife SOS!

title: Eco place
review: Wildlife SOS was established in 1995 by a small group of individuals inspired to start a movement and make lasting change to protect and conserve India's natural heritage, forests and wildlife wealth. Although Wildlife SOS is mainly known for our work with 'dancing bears' we also have active projects to help leopards, elephants, reptiles and other animals.  We also work on various projects targeted at environment and biodiversity conservation, as well as, reducing our carbon footprint. Most known for rescuing more than 600 'Dancing Bears,' & to protect the Asiatic Black Bear, sometimes known as the Moon Bear. From habitat protection to anti-poaching work, they work hard to protect bears across the country.

title: Amazing organization
review: This is an amazing organization that truly does its best to help protect the amazing Indian wildlife. I spent a week working with them and was inspired by the staff's knowledge and passion. If you are in the area I strongly recommend you visit and do what you can to support this great cause.

title: A must go place in Agra  to make it a memorable one.
review: It was a day trip for me and my friends and was invited in the Elephant rescued centre. It really  made our day a memorable one. One can feed them fruits and walk with them for a while. Mr. Biju was really helpful and told us about the elephants and were shown a small move about how elephants are rescued.

title: A Great Experience
review: Wonderful and very instructive.   The Education Director was generous with his time and highly professional.   Animals seem very well-cared for, despite what must be terrible financial challenges in a country where many people are poor and perhaps unable to pay for upkeep of animals just for kindness' sake.  We were very moved by this place.   .

title: Wonderful
review: This is an absolute must see if you have a heart for animals.

title: Connecting with the animals
review: I can't explain how amazing this visit was. Will no with the elephants was enjoyable even though it was sunny. Bathing the elephants was super fun and it was all so amazing!!!

title: Just to look at a elephant
review: Work of this rescue center is deserving of the highest praise. People make their job the best way as possible. Really blessed activity.

title: Wonderful
review: Loved my trip to see the saved elephants, all funded and organized by Wildlife SOS. Our host was generous, kind, and passionate. We got to bathe and feed the elephants. We were also given lunch. Everyone was very nice. It was one of my favorite activities during my visit to India.

title: best experience ever
review: Fantastic experience and gave me memories for life.Excellent service and the staff were very helpful.

title: Amazing Wildlife Park
review: We had a great time exploring at the Wildlife SOS in Agra. Was amazing to hear what the animals have delt with and how they were treated. Thank You so Much.

title: Adorable team who believe! Love everywhere!
review: What an adorable team who believe in What They do! As A Volunteer They give You the opportunity To be close And take care of their majestic friends!!! Felt deeply in Love with that organisation And the way They work! Give! Visit! Follow them!!!! Love And long life To You wildlife sos!!!

title: Awesome place if you love animals
review: Here you can see how animals should be taken care of. All staff is dedicated to care for each bear and other animals. very good setup

title: Of Elephants and Bears
review: In terms of learning something new, visiting the elephant and bear rescue facility was an eye-opener! Learnt a lot about the abuses and privation of the animals there and how they were rescued. Had a great time with the elephants especially!

title: Very Good!!
review: I've been to Wildlife SOS, Agra. Despite it was a short trip I was impressed. Friendly firm, great facility... highly recommended.

title: Visit to Wildlife SOS Agra
review: It was a wonderful experience. So happy to see the animals being looked after so well. Hats off to the dedicated and sincere staff. Will definitely try to come again and spread the word among like minded people.

title: Words can't describe...
review: Words can't describe the appreciation I have!

title: Elephants, Bears, Monkeys, they have it all!!
review: I began following Wildlife SOS during their rescue of Raju. My friend and I decided to plan a trip to work with the ellies. As it turns out, we were lucky enough to be there when Rhea arrived!  What a bonus. We also got to split our time at the Bear Sanctuary (rescued Dancing Sloth Bears).

title: Unbelievably good work by a dedicated team
review: I've been to visit the elephants twice now and the bears once and have such admiration for the people there and the work they are doing.  Everyone is dedicated to the cause and passionate about what they are doing for animals in India (not just elephants and bears).  I've now chosen this charity as one of those I donate to monthly (along with Born Free, UK Wildlife Trust and others) because I really can see the difference they are making to the lives of others.

title: A paradise for rescued bears
review: The bear sanctuary is surrounded by a beautiful and peaceful bird reserve. Here the Bears are able to find peace and fresh, clean air to help them recover from their traumatic former lives. There's a hospital where sick and injured Bears can receive operations to help restore them to better health. They have pens with indoor and outdoor areas, and you can watch them feeding on fruits, porridge and nutritious food, playing with toys or just resting in the warm sun. Some of the Bears will never be fully recovered, they suffer mentally as well as physically from abuse and sickness during their appalling captivity and being made to 'dance' to entertain humans. They are, however, given every care and are able to live out the rest of their lives, secure and content. Wildlife SOS provides an excellent sanctuary for these disturbed and needy Bears, and is a charity very worthy of all the help they can get.  They do a wonderful job for bears and elephants alike.

title: Fulfilling experience
review: Easy to locate the place. Although we got  bit late, our guide Harendra was very much waiting for us. I must say that wildlife.sos is an excellent and thoughtful initiative.We spent time with all the elephants and got to know a lot about them.Their stories are heartening but the way they have been taken care of is commendable.We just missed giving them a bath but other than that we enjoyed ourselves completely.It feels so good to know that someone cares for these speechless wonders. Harendra was with us the whole time, answered all our questions with patience and showed us around with great zeal. I congratulate the team of wildlife.sos and look forward to my next visit.

title: Good work – great experience.
review: I really loved the experience at the Wildlife S.O.S. - they do good work with the elephants and volunteering there and be a couple of hours (a whole day might be a bit to long) part of it was really fun. The elephants are always more important than tourist, that's what I appreciated very much.

title: Rescued sloth bears now have a good home
review: We were too late to see the elephants, but we did visit the sloth bear rescue centre where we learned about the horrible lives the bears had been saved from - lives of slavery, pain and abuse. We were all moved to tears while watching the educational film. The rescued bears can't be returned to the wild as they do not have the necessary survival skills and some are physically disabled by the abuse they were subjected to in their former lives, but they are now safe and secure under the watchful eyes of their carers, who are doing a great job making their lives as happy as possible. We were told that all dancing bears in India have been rescued and their previous owners have also been rehabilitated and assisted to start their own businesses, so they no longer feel the need to enslave bears. Their children are also being educated, ensuring better lives for all. This is one of several sloth bear rescue centres in India and I feel they are really doing a wonderful job. A place well worth visiting.

title: Holiday
review: Visit to see the Bears that have been rescued and are now being cared for

title: Elephants, Bears and Monkeys, oh my!
review: Best part, we were there when Rhea arrived!

title: a trip to remember!!
review: It was an amazing feeling to watch these magnificient beauties freely roaming in their new homes nurtured with love, care and devotion.

title: Perfect day
review: An early start if you want to do the whole day but its worth it. You start with taking the elephants for a walk which is fun as they by walking on the track then some of them start cutting corners, or decide they just want to stop. Then its time to prepare their food and ensure they all get the same amount. Then its off to give them a good wash whilst feeding which gives you the chance to cool off aswell as you'll get soaked but dry off I'm minutes. Then its time for you to eat a good homemade curry. Make sure you take suncream, water and hand sanitiser with you.

title: Wildlife SOS Elephant and Bear Rescue
review: We visited both the elephant and bear rescue facilities in March, 2016.  We did the one day tour of each place.

title: Excellent facility that liberates and cares for "retired" sloth bears
review: Add it to your "to-do" list in Agra - it's close and a very moving experience. Agra isn't all about the TM!

title: Our visit to Wildlife SOS
review: My friend and I enjoyed our visit to the Agra Bear rescue center. Our guide was very interesting and knowledgeable. I wish we were able to visit the elephant rescue center, too.

title: Responsible Eco Tourism and an unforgettable experience
review: Wildlife SOS has both a Bear rescue centre and Elephant Conservation centre just outside of Agra. The bears have all been rescued from the cruel dancing bear trade and now live in peace and safety in huge natural enclosures. You can spend a half-day, full day or volunteer for a longer period at the Elephant Conservation centre. This is an incredible way to get up close to elephants without supporting the cruel practise of elephant riding so prevalent in India with tourists. The money goes directly to an organisation who do such incredible work for animal welfare in India, I can't recommend a visit here enough.

title: 2 hours drive from Agra-but donate the place with your trip
review: We went there just because of the bears. It was pretty hot over 42 C so all animals tried to hide. The noble goal to gather dancing bears worth the goodwill to visit and to give some donation

title: For real animal lovers
review: If you want to visit a place that allows you to see animals but doesn't exploit them, this is it. Great work Wildlife SOS.

title: One of the Best Experience!!!
review: Quite surprising to know about the Wildlife SOS at Agra. It was nice to see the silent and novel work by the team. Thanks to Harendra to give his time and giving us the show around.

title: Trip to a wildlife sanctuary
review: I have visited the Agra Bear rescue facility & the Elephant care and conservation centre at Mathura several times and can't wait to go again! It is a delight to interact with the gentle elephants, bathe and feed them and the beautiful forest of Soor Sarovar with its rich bird life and the rescued sloth bears living a peaceful life at last, is not to be missed by any animal lover.

title: Excellent
review: This was one of the most wonderful experiences that I have ver had. Spending time with elephants and bears improved me as a person and as someone who can be helpful to other living beings. I definitely recommend other people to come and meet with friendly and mischievous animals and what they have to offer.

title: Extraordinary Experience!
review: We visited this sanctuary on our drive back to Delhi from Agra.  It is such an amazing organisation, with staff who are completely dedicated to these animals, all of which have come from abusive backgrounds.  The sloth bears, remnants of the barbaric practice of 'street dancing bears' are now living out their lives in peace and tranquility and we were delighted to be able to donate funds for air coolers for their enclosures.  The rescued elephants are fantastic and we were able to get close to them and stroke them.  I would unreservedly recommend visiting the sanctuary - they need and deserve all the support they can get!

title: Fabulous Trip!
review: I had the time of my life, the people, the elephants, the bears, oh my!

title: An Amazing Bout With Reality Pertain to the Well-Being of Elephants
review: Upon visiting Wildlife SOS, I was amazed at every single person's, dedication to their job in the caring and well-being of the Elephants. I was also amazed at the amount of resources needed for such a feat. It speaks volumes to the people that donate, and serve this amazing cause. Each elephant seemingly had a personality that would draw you into their need to be helped and cared for. It was an eye opener and an amazing experience.

title: Dissapointing visit
review: We especially planned this visit to see the sloth bears rehabilition Center. After paying the entrance fee we were asked for another mandatory donation just to see a video and visit the gift shop. There was no possibility to actually see the bears or take any photos which was our main reason for this visit. We tried to negotiate that we first wanted to see the bears and then make a donation for the amount we felt comfortable with but the donation amount was already set and needed to be paid in advance. We also wanted to receive some further information about the work they do there, but no chance.  To conclude we were very dissapointed with this visit and left without having seen any bears.

title: Level of care and rehabilitation second to none for elephants recovering from abject cruelty
review: We were astounded that so few people - including our hotel - knew about the Wildlife SOS Agra Bear Rescue Facility and were delighted to come upon it on Trip Advisor during our Xmas and New Year India travels. Upsetting and uplifting in equal measures, the facility is a haven and hospital for these magnificent animals whose former wretched lives would bring tears to the most hardened of hearts. The vision, passion and commitment of founders Kartick Satyanarayan and Geeta Seshamani is stamping out the 'dancing bears' practice which demoralises the elephants mentally and physically - leaving them scarred for life. The volunteers are remarkable and the facility deserves continued success. Please help by promoting its inspirational work.

title: Highly recommended if visiting India
review: Our visit to the SOS Bear and Elephant Sanctuary outside Agra was a ray of light in what can often be confronting and challenging conditions when touring India. This organisation is doing incredibly good and important work, offering sanctuary to the surviving bears of the "dancing bears" trade and doing ongoing work to rescue and home terribly abused and injured working elephants. The staff are legends - caring and dedicated to their work and the animals. They are desperate for funds so please visit and help this amazing organisation. It was one of the best things I did on my trip to India.

title: Volunteer Experience
review: Everyone who is able should look into volunteering with Wildlife SOS. It was a remarkable and life changing event for me and I would not trade it for anything. The people in the organization are great and were tremendously helpful at giving me a first class experience and taking care of my needs while I was there. I would change nothing and I will probably go back and volunteer again. I loved it. First rate!

title: AMAZING!!!!
review: I have never had a more incredible experience with animals before. Coming from a house of three cats my animal knowledge wasn't that extensive. To be able to walk with elephants every morning, chop food for them, and bath them was the coolest thing I've ever done. Also building enrichments for sloth bears to play on and chill out in was neat. Very chill organization, awesome guest house, and host's! Recommended for a fun and educational experience.

title: A Visit to the Sloth Bear Sanctuary and Elephant Haven near Agra
review: Very interesting to see the sloth bears that have been rescued. The short visit of two hours is too short to see everything, so plan for most of a day to be spent at the sanctuary and also go to the elephant haven which is a 10 minute drive from the Sloth Bear Sanctuary. The staff were all very friendly and helpful as they took us round and explained what we were seeing.

title: Wonderful experience with wildlife SOS
review: Its excellent to see people have really love and care for wild animal and great work being done by those centers. Thanks.

title: Come and help rescued animals in India
review: Wildlife SOS is doing an amazing job rescuing some of the most needy animals in India.  Instead of spending your money on riding elephants in India come here and volunteer to help the elephants who have been rescued from these horrible practices.  Wildlife SOS also has hundreds of bears who have been rescued from the dancing bear industry.  AND you will get to spend time in beautiful, quiet mother nature which is often had to do in India.  Its an amazing place that should not be missed.  Also please support the important work that they are doing.

title: You just have to visit Wildlife SOS.
review: I travelled to India with a group of friends with India Authentic Tours.  We had a wonderful week with the elephants.  I had visited the Elephant Sanctuary about a year ago but only for a couple of hours, so was very excited to be spending a whole week with the eles.  I wasn't disappointed.  The best part is that we as humans, are there for the elephants as opposed to the elephants being there for us.  The elephants no longer have to 'perform' for human entertainment.  We were able to interact with them on their terms, walking with them, preparing their food and bathing them.  The stories behind the rescues are heartbreaking but thanks to Wildlife SOS their lives are now filled with kindness.  We also managed to squeeze in a morning visit to see the bears.  After all they have been through, it is heartwarming to see them being so well looked after by the staff.  The staff are absolutely wonderful.  I would highly recommend a visit to Wildlife SOS.  It's life changing.

title: Volunteering with Wildlife SOS
review: Throughly enjoyed, a great experience volunteering with the bears and the elephants. Would recommend to everyone!

title: Inspiring work!
review: There is much to admire about the work of Wildlife SOS and what they have achieved to protect and support bears and elephants. I very much enjoyed my visit to the Bear centre outside Agra. This is not a commercial wildlife park or zoo, but a sanctuary for rehabilitating abused animals. As such, we were met at the gate by a very professional member of staff who explained the ethos of the organisation, showed us the facilities and introduced us to bears in all stages of care. We were able to view a video outlining the life and treatment of the 'dancing bears' and the work of the organisation. While there is no entrance fee, it is hoped that visitors will donate to the Centre. The bears are very well cared for and it is wonderful seeing them playing together and relaxing in the sun after a lifetime of abuse and pain. A pen of aged blind animals brings home the cruelty of their former treatment but they can now live out their lives in safety.

title: day in wild sentiments!!
review: beautiful place.with all rehabilitated bears one can really understand the threat of humans on wildlife. i visited here twice

title: Wildlife SOS - put it on your bucket lis!
review: I cannot say enough about Wildlife SOS.  We were brought there on a tour with India Authentic Tours (Teresa Bastian).  What I can tell you from my experience is that Wildlife SOS is a sanctuary that I, for one, will continue to support. The facility is fabulous. Kartick has a vision, and he's making it come true. It is a work in progress, but I must tell you that these elephants are extremely well cared for there. Even the dogs are looked after by the vet if they have a medical issue. His plans for the future include adding more land for more elephants, a huge pool where 5+ elephants can go in together while people can sit on a bleacher type area and watch them, an educational center, and more. This man has a heart of gold and a love of animals as can be seen by going to their Sloth Bear sanctuary where he has rescued all the 'dancing bears', which practice is now halted. I can't say enough about Wildlife SOS.

title: Experience the unthinkable
review: It was really good, Hats off to the efforts of Wildlife SoS. Being a vet myself I highly appreciate the efforts. One should visit esp with childrens so that to teach them that bears are harmless and it was actually us human who were torturing them.

title: Must visit there
review: Yup definitely a place we all need to visit but just a warning its a long walk from the entrance to bear rescue so make sure you get transport...

title: Magical experience
review: Visiting Wildlife SOS was our single best experience on our trip to India. The staff were incredibly gracious and informative. It was sad to learn about the plight of so many elephants, and it helped us be better tourists for the rest of the trip, choosing to respect the animals we encountered, knowing that many, event without visible scars, suffer for their service to tourist.

title: To see rescued wild animals
review: Great work being done by both centres for the elephants and bears.  All animals are looking 100% better. Keep up the good work

title: Humbling
review: Before going to India we decided to stay longer in Agra to spend a day and a half with both the elephants and bears and we are so glad we did. Wildlife SOS are doing amazing work with very little funding and rely on like minded people in thieir quest to rescue circus elephants from a horrific existence. It is heartbreaking to hear the elephant stories from the staff who work there especially poor Raju. Visit if you can & donate online if you are able. We would love to go back and volunteer for a couple of weeks in the future

title: Really great work
review: We visited today and learnt all about the horrific practice of dancing bears. We saw some of the bears but because of the bad treatment from humans you can not approach them as they have lost trust in people

title: Seriously life-changing experience with Wildlife SOS!
review: I volunteered with Wildlife SOS for a week and had one of the best experiences in my life. I traveled alone, and was initially worried about not knowing anyone. The staff at Wildlife SOS made me feel comfortable right away, along with the other volunteers, and I have not shared so many laughs before as I did on this visit. I spent time at both the elephant and sloth bear sanctuaries, and am so glad I spent time at both. If you are even considering volunteering, or even just visiting for a day, with Wildlife SOS, you should just go for it!

title: Excellent experience
review: Such a great facility, taking good care of the rescued bears, elephants, and basically any other local animal that needs help.  We got a tour of the sloth bear facility, lots of info on the bears, and then drove to meet the elephants.  The elephants are so cute and sweet, and we were able to pet them, watch them eat, scrub them down, and I think we could have taken them for a walk if we arrived at walking time.  HIGHLY recommended!

title: Excellent Place
review: One must go there to have fantastic experience.It's not far from Agra. After TajMahal go to the nature.

title: Visit to the Elephant Sanctuary outside Agra
review: Our group was very interested in the wildlife of India, and were able to travel the short distance from Agra to the elephant sanctuary.  The staff were wonderful in spite of the short notice.  For all of us I would say it was the experience of a lifetime, seeing those gentle creatures up close, feeding them and witnessing the incredible care by the staff, the vets, the men who care for the animals, the positive energy is there in what they do..saving the lives of these magnificent elephants.  The gentleness of the elephants belies all that we were told about them...our tour wants to do this on a regular basis in the future.  They are on our list for donations after seeing what they do..

title: Hostile NGO rips you off.
review: Every time I drove on the Agra-Mathura highway, it was at the back of my mind that I wanted to visit the Sur Sarovar Bird Sanctuary. After finallly making to it, I was disappointed with the behaviour of the staff. In the name of wildlife conservation of elephants and bears, the staff rip off the visitors with insane fees for no particular reason. Even if you pay an exorbitant entry fee for your camera and vehicle, they do not allow photography in the conservation centre. The tour by itself lasts for barely 5 minutes. The person escorting you does not allow you to walk leisurely or read the huge information boards placed along the pathway. I will not go back nor will I recomend this place to anyone.

title: Life-Changing Experience; Returning this year
review: There are not enough words to describe the stunning experience I had at WSOS's Elephant Conservation and Care Center. The staff was incredibly kind and generous. The elephants are treated with the utmost care and are slowly but surely being healed after their years of being chained and confined. The Sloth Bear Rescue facility is also well worth the visit. There is great healing being accomplished at both centers. If you are interested in wildlife conservation and are planning a visit to India, include these two centers in your itinerary. Feel free to contact me with specific questions or advice.

title: Amazing animals in an amazing place
review: Called in Sloth Bear and Elephant rescue centres on an organised tour. Bear rescue was good but elephant centre blew my mind. Fabulous animals so fortunate to be cared for by dedicated staff who welcomed us despite our coach being 2 hrs late. They stayed on so we didn't miss the visit.  So worthwhile.  Amazingly gentle animals who are kind and well liked after after a rough start to life or many years inhumane treatment.  Unforgettable.  I will be sending a donation once I get home. Please support this place!

title: A wonderful place that is doing such a great job rescuing animals that have suffered.
review: I visited Wildlife SOS with my husband as part of a group to volunteer for a few days. We were immediately made to feel very welcome. We were volunteering with the elephants & were shown a video, then we were shown around the place & met the elephants who had come back from their morning walk. We chopped fruit & vegetables for them then washed them & fed them. At all times there was a very informative volunteer co ordinator with us to answer questions & to explain the background of the elephants. The elephants are extremely well looked after with vet care as well as being able swim in their private pools when in their shelters. Wildlife SOS does a fantastic job rescuing elephants that have been abused & have suffered so terribly at the hands of humans & they deserve as much support as they can get. Thank you so much Wildlife SOS for taking care of all the beautiful animals that you rescue.

title: EXCELLENT & DEDICATED WORKS
review: I was so surprised by the people who works with dedication for saving the animals especially the Blind bears in Agra. It is a very nice & calm place to visit in the Chaotic  & Dirty Agra City.

title: amazing work being done here
review: Visited the Wildlife SOS sloth bear sanctuary on February 15, 2016 and had an incredible tour to learn more about the awful plight of these bears and the work being done to save them. Visitors need to understand that this is very much a working facility where the staff are doing what's in the best interests of these bears following years of horrific abuse. It's a privilege to see any animal up-close, and I'm incredibly grateful for the experience. This is a nonprofit and they need your help! Made my donation already in honor of all the superb and kind staff. To enter, all visitors need to pay a fee to the forest department. However, NONE of this admission fee goes to the bear sanctuary. So please support the bears! Also visited the elephant sanctuary which of course is equally as amazing. THANK YOU for all that you do!   ~Christy & John

title: What a noble work !
review: I am thoroughly impressed with the work Wildlife SOS is doing at the Bear Rescue Center . We were taken around and were narrated the rescue- history of each bear and even shown an enlightening film of the work Wildlife SOS is doing at other centers by providing alternative means of livelihood to the previous owners of  the so called "dancing Bears" .

title: helping mission for street animals
review: This type of opening are really great and aspiring for others because the animals are not happy with cities but they are enjoying in jungles with there companions. So please kept this spirit and helping animals.

title: A great experience in the lap of nature
review: It was a unique experience. Well maintained. Wonderful work being carried out by the conservationalists. Hats off to them.

title: Great story
review: This sanctuary is well worth the visit. It is a amazing success story that has given these bears a new home in a well structured enviroment. Please visit and support a heart lifting place.

title: A place where these precious gentle giants get another chance at life...
review: I spent two weeks volunteering with Wildlife SOS and its almost impossible to put into words what a profound experience it was for me. I have a huge passion for elephants and animal welfare and thought this would be the perfect opportunity to get close to these magnificent gentle giants whilst finding our more about the amazing work this organisation are doing. Hearing each individual story of every elephant was heart breaking and was often very emotionally overwhelming but it only made me more passionate to spread the word and gain awareness about how barbarically captive elephants are being treated all over India and other parts of Asia.

title: Take this tour off of your schedule
review: This is not a "bear rescue experience".  We were told we were supposed to learn about the bears, the efforts to save them, efforts to educate others about them, be in close proximity for interactions with the bears, etc, etc....instead we walked up to a viewing platform where you could see just two bears in the fenced in area. They were thrown some food to eat and that was it.  Our guide later told us there was some confusion with the management and we would have to have paid even more money for the tour we expected. Total waste of time and money. This was a terrible experience and I would not recommend it to anyone.

title: Elephant Full Day Tour Was the Highlight of India Trip
review: Our family (Parents, Grandparents, and kids ages 6 and 8) took the full day tour at the Elephant SOS Sanctuary. It was among the best experiences of our 3.5 week trip to India! Helpful staff let us walk with, touch and feed the elephants as they roamed free through fields and trees. We then went to their enclosures where we fed and bathed the elephants. The unprecedented access to these magnificent creatures was amazing. Our children, who visited the Taj Mahal the same day, told us "Yes, the building was nice, but the Elephants were really Great!". This was a truly once in a lifetime experience and we would definitely recommend it as one of the most memorable things you could ever do! We absolutely loved it!

title: School trip
review: One of the highlights of our school trip to India, anyone who is in Agra has to visit the sanctuary, so interesting finding out about the job they've done rescuing dancing bears and visiting the sanctuary and donating will go towards a brilliant cause

title: Excellent experience, wonderful staff, meaningful interactions with animals
review: Thank you SOS for a wonderful experience.  Our student group (12 people) loved interacting with the sloth bears and elephants.  They staff is wonderful and the housing comfortable

title: Close up with sloth bears
review: I absolutely LOVE animals and read about this place when I was planning a trip to Agra. We had an auto rickshaw drive us there from our. The signage of the place wasn't that great but our driver managed to find it. You pay an admission fee just to enter the park and you can walk along one path just to see a couple of sloth bears in an enclosure. In order to learn more about them and see even more sloth bears, I recommend taking the tour where they take you "behind the scenes". It doesn't seem like many people pay for this so it was like we had the place to ourselves. The guide tells you more about sloth bears and how they are involved with the cause. We were lucky to see them quite active playing with each other. They also show you a video to educate you more about why and how they are helping sloth bears. They are cute animals and I enjoyed getting the tour "behind the scenes".

title: Bear tour: doing great work but over priced
review: We wanted to learn more about the sloth bears on our trip to Agra. First, I think this organization is going great work helping to protect the bears but as a sightseeing opportunity it is truly lacking.

title: Elephants- up close and personal!
review: We arrived at SOS Wildlife sick and hungry after a harrowing ride from Delhi. The staff specially ordered us a lunch and took care of our sick group members, even though we hadn't reserved a lunch time tour. We were taken around and introduced to the elephants, hearing each of their stories. We got to feed and take pictures with the females, getting up close and personal. The folks at SOS are doing great things to rehabilitate these magnificent creatures.

title: Not worth the time or money
review: The animals and the visitors all deserve a much better experience than this . I would not recommend this tour to anyone.

title: Good work that they're doing
review: Only made it to elephant reserve, no time for sloth bear sanctuary, and even at that, driver passed by entrance a few times. Recommend going on weekend for better experience, didn't feel as welcomed on a Monday as friends had felt a day or two prior. Also felt very pushed into giving "donation," left a bit of a sour taste after that. Otherwise, lots of land for elephants & they seem relatively well-cared for, considering their histories.

title: Bear nd more
review: Wonderful experience.. Went there on my sons first birthday wid family nd friends. I was excited to see bears but was surprised to see every single persons effort to rescue them. These bears were cruelly trained.. Trained to dance nd entertain. Agra is not only for taj but here is much more.. A must visit place.

title: BearHug
review: Great effort. Bears are lovingly looked after. Madaris should also be given job opportunities there.

title: One of the best and most rewarding weeks of my life!
review: I will remember my time with wildlife SOS for the rest of my life.

title: Great place to see wildlife and support great work.
review: Wildlife SOS is a fantastic organisation looking after the welfare of animals in India. Their Agra Bear Rescue Facility outside Agra is a great place to learn about the plight of sloth bears in India and to see the work being done to end the "dancing bear' tradition. There is the chance to see the bears up close and to also purchase handicrafts to support the rehabilitation of the former bear handlers.

title: Good experience, great work being done.
review: Enjoyed visiting the sanctuary and very impressed by the great work being done and the dedication of the staff.

title: Average place with less facilities
review: At entrance gate there were no tickets available and after long wait innerside securities and basic facilities were very very poor. Unplesent .

title: Phenomenal way to interact with Elephants in a humane way
review: If you want to see and interact with elephants in India in a humane way, I highly suggest Wildlife SOS. It's only about an hour with traffic from the Taj Mahal, the staff is extremely friendly, and the elephants are awesome.

title: An experience of a lifetime
review: Come here as a volunteer or simply visit the  Elephant Wildlife SOS sanctuary for the day to experience these animals first hand and learn more about the wonderful work carried here. All the elephants have all been saved from a life of abuse in street trade, circuses or temples in India. This sanctuary is leading the way in fighting for their freedom and providing a safe haven where they can be cared for and healed by teams of dedicated staff and veterinary experts  Either come to spend time with the elephants and be enlightened and uplifted as you learn about their history and come to understand more about what the future holds for these magnificent animals.  The experience at wildlife sos really does enrich you with their kindness, hospitality and knowledge regarding these animals.

title: Not worth watching
review: They show u only 100 meter path n in that v could see only one bear. V have to go there specially for kids sake. But v all were very disappointed.So my personal advice is that don't go there n spent ur precious vacation time some where else.

title: Absolutely Wonderful Experience!
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at both the elephant and bear facilities!  We are a large family, with kids ranging from age 17 to 8, and every one of us loved our time.   We had the opportunity to walk, feed, and wash the elephants, each of which has a sad history but are clearly happy now.   It is exciting to see the success of the sloth bear rescue program, both for the bears and the many families that now have better livelihoods.  The WSOS staff were highly knowledgable, passionate about their work, and sincerely interested in making sure our questions were answered.  I stongly recommend either visiting or volunteering at the center; it was a highlight of our trip!  WSOS also has a hotline number to report illegal or hurt wild animals of any kind.  Get the number in advance so you can report any snake charmers you may see, as this illegal practice is cruel to the snakes.  We saw two charmers in Delhi before our visit and I wished I had the number then.  Visit Wildlife SOS, you won't regret it!

title: The most beautiful experience. A must visit
review: We went with our children ages 3 and 2 who absolutely loved the place. We went for a 2 km walk with a mini herd of elephants interacting freely with them. The gentle giants were ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL. Also there is Mradul who is a photographer we met and who showed us around.

title: Always worth visiting the gorgeous Sloth bears when in Agra
review: So many people come to Agra and visit the Taj but then head straight on to their next destination without realising that the worlds biggest bear sanctuary is right around the corner. Literally hundreds of beautiful bears that have been rescued from the dancing bear trade and now enjoy happy lives filled with love and fun. Please do pay them a visit and show your support for the wonderful work that Wildlife SOS is doing with its international partners Free the Bears and International Animal Rescue to improve the lives of these beautiful bears!

title: Great fun
review: I visited elephant rescue sos with one of my guests from usa.we saw many elephants there & came to know about the sad tales of elephants before they were rescued.It was quite an experience to see & feed the elephants.Thanks to Madumita for giving us excellent tour.

title: Wildlife rescue
review: This was a great facility to visit, and see the excellent work these people do in rescuing and caring for injured or abused wildlife. The animals were well fed, restored to health and cared for in the best surroundings under the circumstances available, with a good amount of open range freedom.  The veterinary attention was impressive.

title: Amazing
review: Everybody told me that I needed to takeme a picture at a temple with an elephant, but this experience was such more better because you see how elephants are rescued and rehabilitated them to have a better life, more that what they used to had before.

title: Amazing
review: Amazing information about every Elephant. The guide gave us a great look at the ways they care for the animals, and were very hospitable. We were greeted with tea and coffee, and a fanstastic video explaining in extra detail the lives of the elephants before they were rescued. Picture taking and meeting of the elephants provided an amazing experience, for everyone in the family. Thanks to the team for allowing us to watch the medical procedure! This place is a must visit if you are in Agra!

title: Simply the best experience you can have whilst travelling India
review: Simply the best experience you can have whilst travelling to India

title: Life Changing Experience at Wildlife SOS
review: I highly recommend volunteering at Wildlife SOS. My favorite part of the day was taking the elephants for a walk.  They are gentle giants and I got to know each of their personalities.  The staff is amazing and they really take care of you throughout the trip while you are taking care of the elephants and sloth bears. I encourage everyone to visit Wildlife SOS.

title: Amazing experience
review: We had booked a whole day with the Elephants as my Daughter was mad on them. Started off with a drink and introduction. Then off to meet the Elephants couldn't believe how close we were able to get to them. We were introduced to each Elephant and given their background story. They were so gentle considering the miss- treatment they had suffered before they were rescued. We were able to walk with 2 x groups of Elephants. Back to base then able to feed some Elephants with fruit. Stopped for a drink. Then able to meet and talk to a vet who was treating an abscess. It is clear how much all of the staff love and care for these gentle giants. Then off to give them a wash and brush up. Finished with a lovely meal. I would highly recommend a visit to this centre as it is an experience we will never forget.

title: An unforgettable experience with elephants
review: Among all the marvels you may find in India—and anyone can imagine how long of a list this might be—going to Wildlife SOS in Agra may be at the very top. You get to touch and feed these beautiful, gentle giants. If this does not change your life, nothing will. These animals are just so beautiful, you will surely be impressed by their presence and obvious intelligence. This is, quite simply, an experience you can't miss if you come to Agra. You will feel like doing anything possible to assist Bheema and the crew with the wonderful job they're doing with the elephants!!

title: Well worth it
review: Rang up and arranged an hour or two before our visit. Very helpful and knowledgeable staff. Our kids enjoyed seeing the elephants happy and safe. They also learnt a lot through the tough tales of the past lives' of these fantastic animals

title: Love and Care for Elephants
review: Visiting the elephants at Wildlife SOS Elephant Care & Conservation Center was so worth the detour outside of Agra!  To see Raju, the 50 year old elephant made famous by a You-Tube video documenting his release from painful chains, snorting with his friend, or cheeky Walnut finding a way to get that last bit of food was a delight.  My first moment at the Center was seeing some of "the girls" going for their morning walk, and later, I was able to help feed them.  Take some time away from visiting forts and temples to interact with the elephants and learn more about rescue efforts from the dedicated staff.  It's a special, moving and happy experience getting to know these beautiful, intelligent giants!

title: Elephant Rescue
review: In November 2015 we visited the Wildlife SOS in Mathura, India, where they have rescued elephants who had been injured and ill-treated. The males could be aggressive so we couldn't pat them but we had the opportunity to feed the females with bananas. They're doing a fantastic work at the wildlife center!

title: Amazing experience with the elephants
review: We spent the afternoon with Naresh, who took the time to tell us the sad stories of the abuse each elephant has experienced, and how they are now helping the elephant heal and learn to trust humans again.  My children also got to touch and feed the elephants (a very moving experience) and watched a vet procedure (cleaning the elephant's eye).  My youngest daughter was inspired by the experience and wants to donate $ from her lemon aide stand to the elephants when we are back in the states.  100% of the entrance fee goes towards supporting the elephants and you can easily stop on your way to or from Agra.  We highly recommend you fit this in to your trip to India.  It was the highlight of our visit, and the kids enjoyed it more than the Taj Mahal!

title: No better way to do good while having fun
review: This place is the REAL deal. They have 18 elephants, rescued from circus', temples, and other places where they have suffered terrible abuse. These elephants now are in a place where they can have a nice life with positive attention and love from very caring, knowledgeable staff. Naresh gave us our tour - a Masters degree in Zoology candidate - he knew what he was talking about! He knew all elephants by name and also knew their habits. We fed the elephants, watched them get medical treatment and played with them. This is highly recommended for anyone that love animals.

title: good job with good staff and the nice moment with the bears
review: i enjoyed the big kiss of Herbi my favorite bear.... !

title: Great conservation efforts
review: We visited the Wildlife SOS elephant conservation center outside of Agra.   They are trying to rescue the working elephants in India.
