I applaud them for their efforts and they're doing a great job.  Unfortunately, they are getting very little, if any help from the government to secure land for these beautiful animals.  So their facility is a little small for the amount of elephants they have rescued in just a very short amount of time. They are doing the best they can by taking them for several walks, a proper diet and medical care.  The elephants are now free of chains and the other cruel tools used to "train" them.  I visited with my family of four.  The kids (ages 9 & 12) loved feeding them. It was a great visit and a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.   We hope to return!

title: My most worthwhile stop in my 3week trip
review: I found the Sloth bear and elephant sanctuary by accident.  Heart rending to imagine such cruelty but inspiring to see what is being done to change the culture.  No hard sell, just committed people trying their best to help the animals.  Wish I could go back and volunteer.  Don't go if you are expecting a show, it is not a tourist attraction.  These are genuine rescue centres working hard with very little resources.

title: herculian task
review: we really enjoyed visiting elephant and bear centres. we spent nearly 3 hrs at both places and had really good time, thanx to baiju for taking us through both centres and answering all our queries to satisfaction, really appreciate courage and work of mr kartick

title: If in India, this is a must!
review: I had the time of my life volunteering with Wildlife SOS and was lucky  enough to spend 3 weeks here. Baiju and the staff were absolutely amazing and very knowledgable.

title: Volunteering Experience
review: I had an experience of a lifetime!  Building structures for the Bears felt incredibly satisfying.  Spending time with the Elephants was truly incredible experience.  I was able to walk with them, feed them, pet them and bath them.  I don't know too many people who can say that!

title: School trip
review: Was amazing and impressive work by wildlife sos. It was good idea to rescue bears and giving them freedom and neutral life.

title: A different experience
review: I really loved your efforts to save those bears and other animals in pain. The documentary you showed our team was heart touching and we all were teary eyed. It was so inspiring to see the way you have helped to rehabilitate the bears, protected them and given them a second life.

title: Great times
review: One of the best times of my life. I had a great time with my family, the people here at wildlife took GREAT care of my family and I. They are just great!!!

title: Touching
review: This is a wonderful place. Seeing how people there are involved to take of rescued éléphants is a releive. Only few people take care of animals like this, especially in India.

title: A Visit that will change the way in which we view wildlife
review: The Bear Rescue Center, Agra is situated in the midst of the scenic Soor Sarovar bird sanctuary. You will need to collect tickets for the sanctuary as well as the Rescue Center. Tickets can be purchased at the gate of the sanctuary. Vehicles are also permitted inside the sanctuary by paying a nominal fee.

title: Fascinating insight into elephant rehabilitation
review: We visited the Elephant Rehabilitation centre only and hence i can't comment on the Bear Sanctuary, but our trip to the Elephant centre was fantastic. The centre has 15 elephants which have been rescued from all over India during the last 5 years. Some elephants were in a really bad way when they were brought to the centre but now they all look healthy and happy. During our 2 hour tour we were introduced to each elephant and given a background on each of their history. We were able to feed a few of the elephants and take photos. The elephants were very relaxed. I would highly recommend visiting the centre if you want to see the work being done to help these fantastic animals.

title: Wildlife SOS Elephant Sanctuary in Agra, India
review: We visited the Wildlife SOS program in Agra for elephants. Their program is amazing to visit while doing important work for injured and mistreated elephants. Our 2 hour visit was personal and informative. We walked around the sanctuary meeting the elephants and learning of the animals' struggles in captivity. We are now going to suggest this be a possible stop on the tour groups agenda.

title: Sloth bear sanctuary's well worth a visit!
review: The sloth bear sanctuary is an amazing place -- you get to learn about the sloth bears and see ones that have been rescued from the horrors of being tortured as a "dancing bear". The wildlife officer was knowledgeable and spoke perfect English.

title: Heart wrenching and inspiring all in the one experience
review: We took ourselves off to the Bear rescue at Agra. Grabbed a car and driver in Delhi, left early and spent the day there. We were deeply moved by the dedication of the staff, the bears in different states of rehabilitation and in general by the whole project. These are the dancing bears of northern India who are rescued and if possible rehabilitated and then can wander for the rest of their days in the bush land dedicated to them. These bears can never be released and the value of having a large area to roam is so important.

title: Great experience
review: We visited the elephant sanctuary at wildlife SOS. It was emotional to hear the stories of what these elephants have been through. The carers are doing a fantastic job of taking care of these animals!

title: Expect to come home a different person
review: I was at this center for just a week, but every day I could see myself change in some small way. The housing provided was sufficient, clean and shared with fellow animal lovers. The work required during the day at the Elephant and Bear centers were challenging but rewarding for sure. The elephant visits start the day off with volunteers being able to walk with the elephants. The entire experience was a dream and something I will always keep with me. A piece of my heart is without a doubt still in India. Bheema particularly took GREAT GREAT care of us. Once you arrive, prepare to be swept away!

title: Definitely worth a visit!
review: We visited the Wildlife SOS centre for a morning while we were in Agra earlier this month. It's an easy taxi ride from the city and the bear rescue centre is set in a beautiful bird sanctuary. Bheema and his team were extremely welcoming and told us all about the wildlife they take care of, before introducing us to the bears and showing us a short video of their plight. We then drove to the nearby elephant sanctuary where we got to wash, feed and stroke the elephants - an amazing experience. While it's very sad to hear how the bears and elephants ended up here, this is a lovely place that really cares about all wildlife. I would wholeheartedly recommend visiting them and supporting their amazing work. Also, do get in touch with them if you see any animal cruelty while you're in India e.g. snake charmers!

title: Loved, safe elephants
review: We did this on a day of seeing the Taj Mahal.  We were jetlagged, but so glad we didn't skip this gem.  They took time to introduce us to each elephant, tell us their story, and they even let us feed/pet some of the more calm females!  You can tell these animals have had tough lives, and are now LOVED and well cared for.

title: Amazing experience
review: A must see while in Agra India! I was fortunate enough to spend one week volunteering at the bear and elephant sanctuary, and it was educational, emotional, and most of all amazing! The staff are so dedicated and the animals are very well taken care of. There are so many extraordinary moments of the week, walking elephants, bathing elephants, bear interactions, surrounding wildlife, and gorgeous views! Would love to come back and spend more time there!

title: Amazing experience with a dozen rescued elephants
review: Our group's visit to the elephant conservancy at Wildlife SOS has been a highlight of our India trip. Our guide was highly informative and helpful, but also vigilant about our safety. During our two-hour tour, we saw over a dozen rescued elephants, heard their stories, and were able to pet, feed and even bathe them.

title: Wonderful elephants, no bath
review: Wonderful place to see and interact with elephants and great guide. However organisation could be easier, it was ok for me as I had a local phone, we also didn't do bath time as suggested. But it was great anyway.

title: study tour
review: i like the place

title: fun, interesting, and a great cause
review: they had 15 elephants and it was a very fun and informative visit, they also let us rinse the elephants and feed them with bananas. we had a great time!

title: Amazing experience for our children and us!
review: We had such an incredible visit to Wildlife SOS. We visited with our two young children (4 and 1) and it was truly a life changing visit for our 4 year old. He was so amazed watching the veterinarian do her work and loved preparing food for and feeding the elephants. It has inspired many questions since about conservation. The people at Wildlife SOS are incredibly kind and the work they do is so important. Thanks for a great visit!

title: Great people doing great things for animals!
review: Our trip to Wildlife SOS in Agra was amazing and informative. We spent a half-day with the bears and then a half-day with the Elephants. The staff here are friendly, knowledgeable and their work is admirable. I asked to see the veterinary doctor and they allowed me to look around the animal hospital and the vet doctor answered every question that I had for him! The short documentary about the dancing bears is touching and it really highlights the amazing things that they are doing not only for the bears, but the people who catch them and make them dance. Seeing the Elephants was also incredible and I loved washing one of them!

title: An Unforgettable Experience
review: My wife and I stopped at Wildlife SOS on the drive from New Delhi to Agra as we were on our way to see the Taj Mahal.  It was well worth the stop and resulted in an experience both my wife and I will never forget.  We arranged our visit in advance and when we arrived at the gate the staff promptly greeted us and the tour began.  The first part of the tour was of the bear sanctuary where they provided background on the types of bears and mistreatment of 'dancing bears' that was occurring in India and other parts of the world.  We then were taken on a behind the scenes tour of the bear habitat and treatment center to house the rescued bears.

title: Visit to Wildlife SOS
review: If you are in town visiting Agra, do yourself a favor and stop by Wildlife SOS.  The staff was friendly and informative, the facilities are quickly improving (enhancements underway), and the animals are simply incredible.  Elephants are some of the most impressive creatures you will ever experience.  I could have spent hours watching them!

title: Moving experience
review: We took some friends here after a visit to the Taj Mahal, and it was the best thing we did during their week long visit!

title: A visit to the elephant santuary.....a dream come true.
review: The 5 of us were met by a wonderful staff member along with 3 elephants in the distance walking towards us !! We were offered a refreshing drink and began our tour. We met every elephant including the now famous Raju. We got to take many pictures while touching and feeding some of the elephants. A must visit pl only a 50 min taxi from Agra, India....bring your camera & bananas :+)

title: boaring
review: There is no enjoy..no attaction you can only see the bears from a high distance managers shuld provide safari ether a gaurd for nerly see the bears

title: Good people doing an important job
review: The tour with wildlife SOS gives you a good glimpse on the great job this NGO is doing. Apart from giving you a one in a lifetime opportunity to feed and care for elephants, the tour itself is very well conducted, informative and moving. The staff is well able to communicate in English, very knowledgeable and willing to answer any question. After the tour you will understand more about the situation of elephants in India and what needs to be done to improve it.

title: Elephant visit
review: I had read good comments and updates from their fantastic Facebook page and I wanted to see elephants happy in India! We had a very friendly tour guide who spoke through the elephants stories and helped us to feel comfortable with the elephants and stroke them. The elephants are well cared for and loved. This is a truly great place with a lot of potential, I can see them having a very successful future. I suggest having a gift shop, I would have bought something! if you are really keen to wash the elephants I would suggest talking to them in advance to check when they are washed.

title: Easily one of the best days of my life
review: My brother and I booked the 2hour tour through the sloth bear sanctuary as well as the day tour at the elephant conservation center.

title: Elephant Sanctuary
review: We were skeptical because we wanted to know that the elephants were well kept for and that the sanctuary is was. As it appeared to us, the elephants were well fed and nurtured. It was great to see them in better conditions than they had previously been living. This sanctuary needs as much attraction as it can get to continue to do the good work it has done so far.

title: Sloth Bear Rescue Centre and Elephant Rescue Centre
review: A friend and I reached the sanctuary around 10 am and a representative was there to show us around. She was well informed and had answers to all our questions. We were pleasantly surprised to see how well kept it was and the condition of the bears.

title: Wonderful and useful visit
review: Very interesting to note that quietly you are doing a commendable job. Hats off to Team Wildlife SOS

title: What a fabulous way to spend a day.........Would highly recommend.
review: We booked the two short visits to the Bear and Elephant centers. We initially emailed Bheema who was very helpful from the start and gave us all information we needed to decide which options were best for us.

title: Best part of visit to Āgra
review: A friend in India recommended we visit the bear sanctuary and elephant centre. I'm so glad we did. It's a little way out from Āgra and annoying to pay the bird sanctuary entrance fee just to get to the bear place. However we all loved seeing the bears and were glad to have learnt how SOS Wildlife has effectively ended the Indian dancing bear shows. Be aware the video is a little gruesome, although our 6 and 8 year olds seemed fine. The bears are well looked after. We then drove to the elephants. It was incredible to see them so close up. Their stories are tragic, but with happy endings now. SOS just needs the funds for more land so it can rescue more elephants. We felt pleased to pay the fees knowing our money was helping this important work. Go visit, especially if you're in Āgra on a Friday when the Taj is shut!!

title: Great Educational Experience
review: These people do amazing work, caring day in and day out for these beautiful elephants. Definitely worth a visit to see how they operate. Warning, this is not a place to touch and interact and have photoshoots with the elephants, which I was kind of led to believe. It's more educational (at least on the short visit) and I ended up a bit disappointed. Many of the elephants said "no photos" and only a  couple were able to be photographed. With that said, it was very educational and I would definitely visit again just to support such a great cause. Keep up the wonderful work, Wildlife SOS. You've saved many amazing animals from a fate worse than most people can imagine.

title: A very worthy charity
review: A fabulous charity doing amazing work. We were guided around the facility, shown where the bears live, their sleeping quarters and the clinic where they are treated. There was a short documentary about why they rescue them and it was really heart warming to see how the cubs who had been rescued where doing as well as heart breaking to see those who had only just been saved, not yet fully rehabilitated. Very touching. They are doing amazing work with the gypsy community who they have rescued the bears from too, so great to see such a holistic approach. Amazing.

title: Cute bears
review: Getting permission to see the animals is quite difficult and that is the reason we could not see elephants but at least able to see sloth bears.Getting a close up of this animal is quite nice but there are not many bears as we expected.We are only able to see 5 bears.Average experience.

title: Bear Rescue Centre
review: Amazing work done by these people in regards to rescuing the bears, elephants and even dogs, taking them into their care, treating the wounds and giving them a better life.

title: bear and elephant rescue center
review: amazing work done by this people. Particapated the volunteering program for two weeks. The animals are in safe hands and it was great to help this people by safing the wildlife.

title: Awesome experience!!
review: I recently spent a week and a half volunteering here and had a wonderful time. I was so impressed with the amazing quality of care the animals received and how helpful the staff was. Wildlife SOS is doing incredible things for animal welfare in India and I hope to come back and visit again soon. Thank you all for your hospitality and best of luck!

title: Unusual and heartening experience
review: We went to the elephant conservation centre by taxi from Agra - about an hour's drive. We arranged a short tour through the website and by phone the day before.

title: Great expierence at the Bear and Elephant Rescur Center
review: I stayed for two weeks as a volunteer at Wildlife SOS. It was a great experience to work with the animals at the Bear and Elephant Center. I miss the elephants already :( I have learned so much from the staff (thanks to Bheema and thanks to everyone who took care of us at WildlifeSOS)

title: Wildlife SOS -- Save Elephants And Dancing Beers from Circuses
review: This is the elephant center, if you like wildlife you are going to love this place. They work to save every elephant from the circuses of India and save every dancing bear from the streets. Beautiful park, open for visitors, open 7 days a week during daily hours sunrise to sunset. If you want a private tour you need to contact the park, they offer a 2-hour short visit showing everything about the center. Located inside Sur Sarovar Bird Santuary. Established in 1995 by a small group of individuals to protect and conserve India's natural heritage, forest and wildlife wealth.

title: Wonderful Elephant/Bear/Animal Sanctuary! An amazing experience that you have to visit!
review: We visited the elephant center and it was truly life-changing experience. This is a place anyone would love to visit especially if you care about animals and want to support saving wildlife.   The center is so well-maintained and the staff so warm and hospitable - I didn't want to leave.  And of course, the elephants!!!! It was so memorable to first walk with the elephants in the morning, visit their enclosures, learn about them and see how this organization, Wildlife SOS has rescued all these animals from abuse, the circus or mistreatment.  We didn't get to go to the bear sanctuary, but I wish we had.  Please visit and support his organization - they are incredible.  We will remember all of our elephant friends, Chanchal, Laxmi, Bijli, Susie, Raju, Mya, Phoolkali,  Bhola and Asha forever.   It's a short trip from the Taj Mahal so if you are visiting that, you must end your trip with this.

title: Amazing experience for everyone!!
review: Wildlife SOS is an amazing sanctuary. I traveled to the elephant reserve with family. The two people working there were fantastic. It was so inspiring to see people treat animals with such respect and love. After hearing the rescue stories of all the animals, we were walked through a daily routine and medical treatments for each elephant. We fed and interacted with the animals, all the while the employees monitored and maintained a safe environment. They made sure that everyone was comfortable during the experience. I would HIGHLY recommend going to visit or even learning/supporting this organization. After hearing of each animals past it was refreshing and enlightening to see people's dedication to help these animals. Not expensive and it was a donation to the elephants.

title: Very disappointing experience
review: I went to kitham bird sanctuary and visited bear rescue center. There was Only a small trail leading to a cage looking upon bear habitat. But there was a security guard who went inside with us unknown of any wildlife knowledge. He was utterly rude and insisted to get back to exit after 5 minutes. Please watch out this place may be you find it serine but bear rescue park was a complete let down !

title: I am Impressed
review: India is said to have the best wildlife protection laws in the world, and this place provide us the glimpse of the same.

title: Our guide Prathamesh Desal was absolutely fantastic! He is so passionate about conservation and the care of the animals.
review: A big big thank you and your amazing guides! Today was so inspiring and a life time experience. I am already a huge supporter from South Australia and today I got 2 more people on board who are going to start donating as well!

title: Awesome place and nice people
review: People who work there are very friendly and so nice. When we were there guys kept asking if we want some water it was hot that day. If you are an elephant maniac you must visit there once! We truly had a great time there! Wish could visit there again!!

title: ELEPHANT RESCUE CENTER
review: A big congratulations for this young project , the elephants are stunning , very well treated, no slavery , no harm , no elephant rides !!!! Just " elephants being elephants " ; I had an " elephantastic time at the elephant center and also ad the bear center .

title: Fantastic experience
review: Such an amazing experience walking with the elephants and feeding them! The elephants are well looked after and all seem very happy! It was lovely making friends with them, especially Suzie the elephant!

title: Wonderful experience
review: I had a great day at the elephant center. I learned so much and had tons of fun just being around the animals. Got to bathe a couple of the elephants and feed them. Later before sunset we did a walk that was a great finish to an already amazing day.

title: Bear rescue
review: The work that the center is doing for rescuing bears it's wonderful. If you are animal lover you will feel really glad about this place.

title: Don't want tourists they said
review: Had the worst experience at first, took 1.5 hrs from Taj Mahal and on arrival we got charged 1.100rup to enter park and wildlife bird sanctuary. We obviously didn't read the website thoroughly enough because we were expecting to see elephants as well but that was another $3000 and 15km away from wildlife park. We initially saw one bear sleeping and were told that was it, we'd have to pay another 1.500rup per person to see more bears. Our driver complained for us and they opened the gates, it's given us a better understanding now as to why they don't want tourists. Would not recommend you go there unless you are going for the day and a animal enthusiast.

title: Good job
review: We stopped here on our way back from visiting the Taj and it was so well worth it.The work going on here is fantastic! Really good effort put into the camps!

title: Amazing Effort!
review: The work going on here is fantastic! Really good effort put into the camps! Serving in these camps was very fun.

title: Fantastic experience for animal lovers
review: What an amazing place we were met by one of the guides at the front gate who gave us so much information about how they are rescuing the sloth and asiatic bears from extreme cruelty. They the look after them and re habilitate them. We got up close to a few of the bears. Next stop was the elephant sanctuary part of SOS here were informed about the rescue of several of the elephants before being able to feed a groups of three if them. We then had a fantastic time bathing and scrubbing the elephants which they also seemed to enjoy. Please visit this place and help them continue their amazing work. Thank You SOS for an amazing few hours

title: WONDERFUL RESCUE CENTER FOR ELEPHANTS
review: After seven days volunteering in spring 2015 I can warmly recommend this center. It's a wonderful place to visit and learn more about those intelligent and sensitive animals. Wildlife SOS earn a big thank for rescuing and rehabilitating elephants and taking a good care of them at the Elephant Conservation and Care Center in Mathura. I was absolutely delighted too see how well the elephants are treated there. I was so happy to be able to feed and shower them and to go for a walk with those dear eles. I had an unforgettable time. I want to thank you Wildlife SOS' team for this opportunity!

title: Good cause, terrible attraction
review: Although the case is a worthy one better to send them money rather than waste time at this truly boring and ill conceived attraction.

title: Incredible day at Wildlife S.O.S.
review: I support Wildlife S.O.S for about 6 years and have been in their both rescuer centers.

title: The Agra Bear Rescue run by Wildlife SOS is a must visit!
review: The Bear Rescue Facility in Agra, run by Wildife SOS adds a touch of difference to a city usually known for its stunning historical monuments. We visited the facility and had such a grand experience - observing the rescued sloth bears playing or lazing around happily, learning more about their traumatic past lives and how they are doing now. They are beautiful.

title: Amazing experience!
review: I've been there twice now, and both experiences have been amazing. The work that Wildlife SOS is doing is incredible and it is almost life changing to be able to interact with these amazing animals in person.

title: A highlight of our India trip!
review: Before an afternoon visit to the Taj Mahal, a friend and i visited the elephant sanctuary to learn a little and to do something a little unusual. It did not disappoint - the sanctuary seems to be doing great work, and we had fantastic access to the elephants. We were taught a lot about the elephants, their individual personalities and the reverence (but also some poor treatment) of the animals in Indian culture. It was also a refreshingly flexible and interactive experience that felt more like a personable tour and guide round the area from a friend than a formal tourist activity (which it isn't, really - the place is a functional reserve first with incidental tourist opportunities if anything).

title: This was again the most memorable trip of my life! NOTHING comes close.
review: I have visited this place again for 2nd time now. What an experience. Selfless service these guys are doing there.. Such a love for animals and Once you hear the heart wrenching stories of animals there, there would be a definite paradigm shift in your thinking! This motivates and prepares me for all the hardships in life. LIFE IS BEAUTIFUL! Enjoy it!

title: Beautifull Bears
review: This is an extremely well run facility, make sure you pre book so that you will be met at the gate and shown around. You get to meet all the different bears and see the great work that is being done.

title: Once-in-a-lifetime Experience
review: If  you love wildlife and are visiting Agra, please stop here.  This organization saved every dancing bear from the streets of India.  Now they're working to save every elephant from the circuses of India.  The park is beautiful.  Be sure to walk with the elephants in the morning.

title: Dream come true
review: For animal lovers  - volunteering at Wildlife SOS is a dream come true.   For everyone else, it will be an amazing experience to visit.  Great educational place for kids too.

title: Highly disappointing...
review: Me n my wife both r animal lovers n after reading all the reviews we decided to ditch visit to fatehpur sikri n come here to wildlife sos instead as we had time for just one n really it was a bad decision. I m glad if other visitors enjoyed thier time but we entered the gate n few 3 or 4 meters away only got to see 3 sloth bears n 3 or 4 meters further more got to see 2 more n thats it ... thats the visit we had. We were told this is the only thing. .. nothing more. There was noone to talk... just one person who told us that there is nothing more to see n we cud go now. It is rescue centre but i did not get any such vibe... overall visit lasted for 20 mins that too cos we wanted to stay. N after such treatment the ticket centre guy had the audacity to shout from a distance ... ' sir donation for bears'... i wud have happily donated for sure but after such a visit i m pretty sure donations dont go to bears... i really wish i had something good to say so that more ppl cud visit this...

title: So so
review: The bear rescue is set in the country near a lake that is part of the property and great for birding.  The rescue center is new and perhaps larger groups have a better experience. We paid an entrance fee and walked maybe 75 feet on an elevated walk until it dead ended.  In the distance we could see a bear.

title: I was a part of this Agra Bear Rescue Facility.
review: I was the General Manager of The TajView Hotel Agra, & I came across  Karthik,one of the main organisers of this facility with his team members.This was the year 2001-2005.

title: volunteer experience
review: I have had an amazing experience, staff are all so friendly and can not do enough for you, it is like being apart of one big family. Food was excellent! They also have an elephant conservation centre down the road where you can feed, walk and muck out the elephants- this is a must if you are visiting!!  I would definitely think about returning :-)

title: What a project, well done to you all
review: Visited this project on February 23rd with my wife and son who is very interested in this idea of animal rescue. We were given a tour by such a knowledgeable guide called Prathamesh and he had such a passion for his work it was a pleasure to see. The bears at the sanctuary have all been rescued from a life of hell as a dancing bear. Credit must go to all who work at this amazing project which actually supports approx 230 bears. This is not on the tourist list to visit but in my opinion should be promoted by travel companies as the work that is done here is nothing short of amazing. The bears now have a quality of life, given plenty of area to roam, a wonderful diet and fed twice a day and the care they deserve from the team that work there.

title: Interesting
review: The bird sanctuary is actually the most interesting bit as you get to see quite a lot of animals, mainly birds on the banks of the lake. The actual bear rescue center was interesting but somehow a bit of a let down. There's a lot of posters to give you information about the bears and other spieces foudn in that forest but you don't actually get to see any bears. We were lucky two fo them were asleep in a hole not far from where we standing and managed to see a bit of fur but otherwise, you are told by the guide that the bears are mainly nocturnal and that you will not see them as they are sleeping. They offer to pay even more money once inside the centre to get to see the bunker where they sleep which we declined as we had already paid quite a lot for not much really. I'm happy we contributed to help the rescue centre but somehow felt a bit ripped off.

title: An excellent facility
review: We recently spent a couple of hours at the Wildlife SOS facility.  We only say the sloth bears because the tour was 2 hours long and we did not have time to see the elephants as well.  The facility is great and they do a wonderful job.  The only criticism I have is that the tour could have been shorter so we could have seen both animals.

title: An excellent experience, well worth a visit!
review: We visited on 26th of February whilst staying in Agra. We booked to go to both sanctuaries, and hired a driver for the day from Agra which was 2000 rupees(cheap considering time and distance). The Bear sanctuary is located near Kheetham lake just off NH2 and the bird reserve is called soor sarovar (not Bharatpur/Keoladeo Np like some drivers may think you mean). The drive takes 40 mins to 1 hour depending on traffic.

title: in phase with the animal wildlife AND the people
review: Thanks to Robin who greeted us, we spent a great time visiting the bears and the elephant facility, with my son, 10 years old.

title: A must see!!!
review: Visiting the Wildlife SOS Bear Rescue facility was the highlight of my trip to Agra. Seeing the good work all the team do to help the bears is just breathtaking. I only wish I had time to go to the elephant rescue facility. The rescue centre is a MUST SEE !!!!

title: Highlight of Agra
review: Sure the Taj is great but this is amazing. We only had a short amount of time but Robin was great and helped us to see the bears and elephants in the short amount of time we had available. We only wish we had a longer visit, but are already planning a return visit for a longer period of time. If your planning to visit Agra, don't just think about coming, make plans to come here. You will not regret it!

title: Must see in Agra!!! Amazing experience:)
review: Inspirational place!! Very friendly guide and gives you all the time you want there. Great work done here, keep it up. Only 17km outside Agra! U really feel like ur giving something good to the community by visiting!! We saw the bears being bears, mating, playing, eating and fighting, all round once in a life time experience. Only wish we had more time so we could visit the elephant sanctuary, definitely next time!!

title: Also the best day of my life !
review: How amazing ! This is a NOT TO BE MISSED experience. Thank you to all the helpers and care takers not to mention the sponsors, without them, these projects would not exist. The animals are in such great care and I can't wait to come back. They still need a lot of help and funding.

title: Taj Mahal, move over!
review: If you are going anywhere near Agra/Vrindavan/Mathura, my advice to you would be to ditch the Taj Mahal trip (or any other tourist attraction) and visit the Wildlife S.O.S bear rescue facility. There is also an elephant sanctuary nearby and the work done by the folks over there is PHENOMENAL. The people accompanying you and guiding you around the place are super friendly and let you take your time with the bears/elephants.  A must-see attraction bolstered by people who really care about the animals. How many places can you get to interact and be up close with animals that people normally view from a distance? A place that I am going to come back to multiple times. Thank you very much Baiju, Robin, Naresh and Chris! You guys are awesome. Keep up the good work and thank you for being the highlight of my 2 day trip. My only regret is that I couldn't spend more time. :)

title: Animal lovers dream!
review: I am so glad that we took the time to visit WSOS!!

title: Best trip ever to wildlife SOS
review: Had an incredible educational time at wildlife SOS. Was able to get up close to the elephants at this reserve and learn lots of interesting facts about them.  The bear sanctuary is amazing as well and it's so heart warming to learn of the life these animals have been saved from. I highly recommend the volunteer programs that they offer. Get in touch with nature and enjoy the peace and tranquility of this beautiful place.

title: Awesome experience
review: This place was an eye-opening experience...we went to the Elephant Sanctuary and fell in love with these creatures...gentle and dignified...naughty and restless....shy and loving...the personalities of these beautiful animals have to be experienced to be believed...

title: Visit to Elephant Care & Conservation Centre, 8th Dec 2014
review: I and my family (parents, 2 kids of age 2 years and 5 years) visited Wildlife SOS ECCC on 8th Dec 2014. Even before the visit, the response over email and phone with Wildlife SOS was highly professional. During the visit, Prathamesh Desai of Wildlife SOS took the experience to a whole new level. He told us interesting facts about each elephant at the centre. Opened our eyes to the atrocities committed against these majestic creatures. Educated us that even taking a ride on elephant back (or any other animal's back) hurts the animal badly and so should be avoided. facilities were well maintained and hospitality was great. Charges seem high but given the amount required for upkeep of these animals, they are very reasonable. Overall trip took 2 hours or so. My kids were mesmerized! They enjoyed feeding the elephants on their own and we all came back with a memorable experience of a lifetime!

title: Visiting and volunteering at Wildlife SOS
review: This is a fantastic place to visit rescued dancing bears and abused elephants. I had the opportunity to be close  to the animals without interfering with them. Helped to build climbing frames for the bears (enrichment) As well as helping to feed them.

title: Bears, great work, but don't take a visible camera
review: Sadly we did not have enough time to do a full private tour but saw enough of the wonderful work being done here to feel we had to contribute when we got back to the UK - so we could use GiftAid through the British registered end of the Charity. A tip to those intending only to see the bears and in possession of a camera.  To get to the bears  you have to pass through the bird sanctuary.   Once you get to the bears you cannot take photos as the cameras remind the bears of tourists, dancing and all the horrors of their past.  Even if you tell the people manning the gate to the bird sanctuary that you do not intend to stop and photograph birds and are only interested in the bears, they will insist on you paying 1,000 rupees to take a camera past the gate - if they see it.  I would advise anyone to put the camera away in the boot of their car and give the money saved to the bears - that's quite a lot of honey.

title: Volunteering at Wildlife SOS
review: Back for our second visit to Wildlife SOS's bear and elephant centres outside Agra. The staff couldn't have been friendlier and more helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The care and empathy shown not only for the elephants and bears (many of whom have had traumatic lives) but also for other wildlife and domestic animals brought to the facility was admirable. These people truly love animals of all shapes and sizes.

title: Heaven for animals
review: Wildlife SOS is doing an amazing work at saving wild animals who had traumatic lives being exploited for entertainment and money. They rescue all kinds of wildlife, and educate the population exploiting them to get the problem at the root. Visiting their center contributes to their wonderful and life-saving work so I definitely advise everyone to visit. On top of that, you get a once in a lifetime experience with these animals. They all have a heart breaking story, but I have no word to describe the feeling of seeing them roaming around with other animals. You have to experience it yourself!

title: Volunteering and Visiting Wildlife SOS
review: I had the amazing opportunity to visit Wildlife SOS in Agra and volunteer at both the Bear Rescue and Elephant Care and Conservation Centers. The animals are incredible and show a deep love and trust in the staff, handlers and volunteers. There is so much care and thoughtfulness, as well as hard work that goes on in order to help keep the animals safe, as well as rescue others in order to provide them with a more enriched life after years of cruelty and captivity. I fell in love with each and every animal and got to see their distinct personalities. The staff is wonderful, kind and caring and working tirelessly to make life better for the animals as well as to educate people. This was an opportunity of a lifetime and I highly recommend people to visit Wildlife SOS, become a volunteer and/or a supporter. On your next trip to India, make this a priority visit. It will change your life for the better.

title: A trip to Wildlife SOS
review: I had planning the trip since a long time and I wasn't disappointed.Bear sanctuary is beautiful, located in the jungles of Soor Sarovar Bird Sanctuary .It is incredible to know and see the dancing bears are rescued and rehabilitated here.You can also sight spotted dears here and yes, amazing diversity of birds.The elephant sanctuary is also an amazing place where ill treated elephants are rehabilitated.You can have a spiritual experience while spending time with the elephants and feeding them papayas(female elephants).Stay away from the males as they can be dangerous when they are in there musth.

title: WSOS is heaven on earth for the animals and carers are the best.
review: I have been visiting the facility almost every month for the past two years and each time I am amazed at the dedication of the staff and management. The Bears and Elephants are happy and healthy and its a real joy to go there. They feel safe and secure and loved.

title: Lifetime Trip
review: I visited Bear and Elephant Rescue facilities with my wife and two boys. We enjoyed our visit. We had a good time and excellent interaction with elephants.

title: These places are beautiful homes of life and new opportunities for these rescued animals.
review: I was floored when visiting the bear and elephant rescue centers because they were just amazing and touched my heart. These animals all have a second chance at life and it was an honor to meet the dedicated staff that help ensure these animals do have a second chance. You could just feel the passion in both settings and the staff were so informative about the animals and their lives. I truly have developed a stronger passion for wildlife after visiting these facilities.

title: Amazing cause. Selfless people
review: This is an absolute must if you have a couple of hours to fill. We saw the Taj and the Fort but they were nothing compared to this amazing place. Please please please take the tour for 1500rps as all of it goes to the projects that this amazingly dedicated organisation provide. Due solely to wildlife sos there are NO more dancing bears on the streets. The Very poor Kalendar communities who previously owned the tortured bears are educated and given money to start a business (rickshaw/ fruit shop etc). The women are taught a craft (of which you can purchase at the gift shop) and ALL the children are given a scholarship- even the girls! And what's more is that wildlife sos pays for the girls dowry as long as the families promise to send them to school and not let them marry until 18 (when normally they would have had 3 kids by then). I cannot recommend this place more highly. Please go!!!

title: A must visit for any animal lover!
review: I highly recommend booking a tour to visit this amazing sloth bear and elephant rescue/sanctuary!  I have visited other high profile rescues around the world and was super impressed by the tour (ask for Robin), the entire team and the great care given the animals.  It's important to book the tour in advance or you won't get the full experience.  I was so moved hearing the stories of each of the rescued elephants and loved feeding them and accompanying some of them on their evening walk.  The program instituted by Wildlife SOS to eradicate the cruel practice of bear dancing is a model other animal advocate groups should follow.  They not only saved the bears from this horrific life but they lifted up and improved the welfare of the people in the community.  Outstanding experience!  Don't miss it if you are in Agra!

title: Amazing place & great cause
review: What an amazing place!!! I highly recommend everyone stop in and meet the team at Wildlife SOS. If you want to go to the elephant rescue centre, you will need to call in advance and inform them when you will be arriving and how many are in your group. We were there for about 3 hours, and spent time learning about Indian elephants, washing the elephants and giving them lots of treats (big pieces of watermelon). After the elephant rescue centre, we went to the bear centre, which was also excellent. They've done a great job educating people about the tortured lives of the "dancing bear" and how the Wildlife SOS is trying to change the lives of these adorable bears.

title: Great work being done
review: We stopped over here on the way back to Delhi from Agra. Not knowing the full history behind the dancing bears, we were both surprised at this tradition and amazed by the work being done here to prevent this further. We had a really friendly tour guide who was thorough and worked to our time frame. Wish we would have had 90 minutes to do the full tour.

title: Incredible experience!!
review: I would highly recommend booking a private tour and taking the time to visit both the bears and elephants. It's heartbreaking to learn about how these animals were treated but amazing to see how well they have been rehabilitated and how well the staff care for them. I had Robin as my guide and he was just awesome - so knowledgeable! It's especially interesting to hear how Wildlife SOS have involved the local community in the rehabilitation process and given them other means to sustain themselves. The evening walk with the elephants is just a wonderful experience and something I'll never forget. Thank you Robin!

title: Great place for animal lovers
review: The bears and elephants are just adorable. I am so glad to see the rescue and conservation efforts done by them.

title: Excellent Visit
review: We spent a few hours at the bear rescure facility.  What a wonderful place and the staff are great.

title: A wonderful place indeed
review: If your an animal lover and you're in the area, this should definitely be on your list of places to visit.

title: deserving your time and support
review: If you have an extra half day in Agra, i highly recommend going to this place. It is a wonderful refuge for rescued dancing sloth bears, and other animals. They need your support for the great work they do!

title: Animal roaring is important to mind screw
review: Peoples throw dust and un mentionable things across the tourist spots was an regret issue every where.

title: Sanctuary for "Dancing bears"
review: The indescribable cruelty of the cretins who took these babies, killed their mothers, and pushed red hot rods through their noses to make holes for the ropes and chains which they yanked to make to make them "dance" makes one sick. Thank the Gods for the people who are putting a stop to these foul practices. These rescued bears are living the good life here, obviously relaxed and enjoying just hanging out.

title: Has potential but need to do better
review: To start with, our tour guide had never been to this place so the driver had some trouble finding it. Then we were stopped miles before the place where we had to pay a hefty fees, incl. for taking photos (1000 INR). Once we arrived at the bear place, we had to fill some lengthy forms only to then see a sign 'no photos' - which we ignored since we paid all that money... One local guard showed us around but didn't have much to say. We asked him about the elephants but he didn't know about them! The bears were cute though! We would have loved to know more about their stories!!

title: Life changing experiance at The Elephant Haven :)
review: Such a fantastic place!! The elephants are sooooo delightful and each has a story behind them.Prathamesh and the other staff do an amazing job caring for these beautiful animals.Its such a good cause helping to support these rescued Elephants,and they require a lot to keep the facility running and the animals healthy,so the more support they get the better.I spent a whole day helping at the Elephant haven.We walked the females in the big field outside the enclosure and it was so special to see them being as free as they can be,chain free,foraging and snacking on wild plants..just amazing.Then I helped prepare some fruit for them,then I got to wash 2 with a hose.Each elephant is so special and they truly left a big impression on my soul.I will return !! x

title: Don't miss this remarkable heart warming Bear Sanctuary.
review: The Wildlife SOS Bear Sancurary is an easy drive about an hour out of Agra and a place that will restore your faith in humanity, especially if you love animals. All of the Bears at the sanctuary have been rescued from a previously cruel existence as 'dancing bears', a practice now outlawed in India. The large green sanctuary is very well designed and you can read the Bears' stories along a well signposted track that leads you past their open enclosures full of climbing structures and other items of enrichment. Plenty of monkeys will keep you company and you can watch feeding time or simply enjoy watching the play among the Bears. We found the keepers very helpful, especially at the visitors center where we watched a film on how Free the Bears Australia helped implement sustainable community development plans for the Kalandar gypsies, and learned that some of their children have now grown up to become keepers at the sanctuary. It's a beautiful place and I'd love to visit again.

title: The most amazing afternoon
review: Visiting this amazing place has been a highlight among many memorable events in India. The people are so passionate, professional and knowledgeable that you can't help but leave inspired. I wholeheartedly support their work and would like to stay as a volunteer in the next few years after my afternoon speaking with staff and meeting the beautiful bears. Can't speak highly enough of their work!

title: Elephants
review: We visited the elephant centre on 29 October.  We spent around two hours being expertly guided around and introduced to the 9 elephants - each with a story about their past and how they had been treated.  We fed several elephants water melons and bananas.  They are beautiful creatures.  The Rupee 1,500/person entrance fee may seem high, but this a unique experience of meeting well cared for elephants and supporting their ongoing work.

title: Fantastic time, a must see!!!
review: I found out about this place just a few days before my trip. And I knew about Raju the crying elephant from a buzzfeed post so when I read in the review that the elephant sanctuary was closed I was a bit sad. But I still wanted to see their great work with the bears so I went anyways and I was not disappointed. I had a guided tour and got to know about the amazing work they do, if I get a chance to visit again I will definitely consider being a volunteer.

title: a good cause
review: I only found out about this "attraction" by reading TripAdvisor - so thank you to all you reviewers who came before me.

title: My visit to bear facility and elephant conservation center
review: I had the best time of my life by serving those beautiful animals. Lovely place, amazing people and hospitality. I can only recommend to all nature lovers. Please do visit.

title: A great experience!!!
review: The tour of the Elephant Sanctuary, followed by the Bear Rescue facility was really great. The stories about the torture which some of the animals have been through, and how they are now being looked after to make them feel normal are really interesting. The close interaction with the elephants was one of the highlights of the trip. The bears are kept in very neat accommodation, which includes air-coolers to help them combat the heat in this region. The medical facilities at the rescue center were also superb. Very well done Wildlife SOS!!!!!!

title: HELP THEM THEY DESERVE IT
review: Having planned to visit the shrine of elephants to meet the famous RAJU and the beautiful LAXMI, I was greeted by Prathamesh that with extreme kindness devoted me three hours to explain the history of each elephant and show how they were woriking. I also assisted in the care of a bull covered of abscesses and wounds and it is with great admiration that I have seen how the team was treating the animal ..I only regret I could not go  with the elephants for their afternoon walkl or visiting the center bears; I hope to return one day and I can only recommend this visit useful and enjoyable and encourage you to donate to help saving suffering elephants in India.

title: Highly recommend a visit to see the bears and elephants
review: I visited the Agra Bear Rescue Facility as part of a group tour organised by World Expeditions. Having visited the bear sanctuary several times before (my organisation supports Wildlife SOS), I was pleased to see how well the bears continue to look in their stunning forested home after their painful former lives as dancing bears on the streets of India. I also had the chance to pay my second visit to the Elephant Care and Conservation Centre where we met Raju, the famous elephant rescued in July of this year after 5 decades of agony. Beyond the Taj Mahal, there were previously limited opportunities for tourists but I would highly recommend staying an extra day (or two) to visit these inspiring sanctuaries so that you can learn more about efforts to protect India's incredible wildlife.

title: Beautiful days with bears and elephants
review: We visited the bear rescue center on our way from Delhi to Agra and then the elephant sanctuary on our way back to Delhi the following day. Both experiences were amazing. We especially loved our day with the elephants- we spent about 5 hours at the sanctuary and got to wash the elephants, see them play in their pool, and take them for a two hour long stroll through the country side. The staff was very friendly- even coming out to the main road to meet us so that we wouldn't get lost on the back roads leading up to the elephant sanctuary. We won't forget this experience, the kindness of the staff, and the power of forgiveness that these animals teach us.

title: The best day of my life
review: The Taj is of course the most spectacular man made building on earth but the bear and elephant sanctuary run by Wildlife SOS an hours drive out of Agra is top of  my list for a life changing experience if you love animals. Getting up close to these rescued elephants and seeing the Bears having the freedom to be bears again is truly uplifting. Not to be missed if you are in Agra.

title: Bear Rescue facility
review: They need no review as such, there work describes it all. From the story of Raju being rescued to the story of dancing bear, it all originates from Wild Life SOS. They have a facility in GGN also and visited there too.

title: Amazing place. Well worth visiting if you are in Agra for Taj Mahal
review: I volunteered at Agra Bear sanctuary for two days on my trip to India. It was amazing to see these beautiful animals safe after their life as dancing bears. Wildlife SOS have managed to rescue all the dancing bears in India and their hard work can be seen by how good the bears look and live now. The staff and keepers at the sanctuary are so helpful, informative and dedicated. Even if you don't volunteer to help it is worth just a visit if you are in Agra to see Taj Mahal. Was one of the highlights of my trip.

title: Worth seeing !!
review: I hd never heard f this place. Luckily i stumbled across its website while looking for tourist places in and around Agra.We decided to visit this bear rehab center. Got in touch with one f the officers there n booked a guided tour fr ourselves. Wr wre charged rs 2000 fr a guided tour fr 90 min  whereby we wre taken to all the cages and areas where the bears lived. We wre also told abt  the pathetic conditions f the sloth bears before being brought to the rehab centre.

title: Awesome for volunteering
review: I just spent a week volunteering at Wildlife SOS Agra working with the Sloth Bears and elephants. What a great learning experience, one that I will cherish and remember forever. Thanks Wildlife SOS and all of the amazing staff and animals!

title: See, Touch and Feed Elephants at Elephant Rescue
review: Go to the elephant rescue centre. You can feed elephants some bananas. The mahouts are patient.  Please donate even a little money as this goes to feed for the elephants.

title: Worth Paying a visit while in Agra
review: Excellent facility developed by the Wildlife SOS, with the help of Deptt. of Forest, U.P. Govt. They have successfully rehabilitated the Sloth Bears after rescuing them from the Kalandar tribesmen who were making them dance on streets for money thus were called "Dancing Bears' of Agra. The facility is very nicely developed & the Bears are well taken care off.You can see Happy Bears playing & climbing trees all over..

title: Nice to see
review: Really nice place clean for the bears, not smell even if it was really hot, but go early morning or end of the afternoon becausse if too hot bears are not out

title: What a great org! They are doing such great work with animals in India.
review: I misunderstood the email and didn't realize the tour would be cut short because the elephant sanctuary was closed. I could have spent the whole 4 hrs at the bear center it was so interesting! I had no idea about how the bears were treated. Wildlife SOS is doing truly amazing things. I didn't want to leave when it was time to go. I donated after the tour and I think I will sponsor a bear soon if I can with my students. The guide's enthusiasm, passion, compassion and knowledge was infectious ( thanks Arput Kubba!), and English was flawless, and that's coming from an English teacher :P( I've been on tour situations here in India where I was promised an English speaking guide and the reality was way different). I also didn't know until after when I visited their fb page that this is the org that helped Raju. He is famous worldwide! I hope him a speedy recovery and I am devastated I couldn't visit that part. Just another reason to return, which I hope I can. I have no educational background in animal rescue or conservation so I have no idea how I could be of use as a volunteer, but if/when I come back to India I will definitely check volunteering opportunities out! And p.s: the bears are adorable. If I was leaving agra any later I would have visited again tomorrow.

title: Amazing!
review: It was great to see all the rescued bears doing so well. The organization does wonderful work for wildlife and really makes an effort towards their quality of life. Highly recommend!

title: Great org! (I already e-mailed to delete the old review with incorrect guide name but it has been over a week)
review: I misunderstood the email and didn't realize the tour would be cut short because the elephant sanctuary was closed. I could have spent the whole 4 hrs at the bear center it was so interesting! I had no idea about how the bears were treated. Wildlife SOS is doing truly amazing things. I didn't want to leave when it was time to go. I donated after the tour and I think I will sponsor a bear soon if I can with my students. The guide's enthusiasm, passion, compassion and knowledge was infectious ( thanks Prathamesh Desai!), and English was flawless, and that's coming from an English teacher :P( I've been on tour situations here in India where I was promised an English speaking guide and the reality was way different). I also didn't know until after when I visited their fb page that this is the org that helped Raju. He is famous worldwide! I hope him a speedy recovery and I am devastated I couldn't visit that part. Just another reason to return, which I hope I can. I have no educational background in animal rescue or conservation so I have no idea how I could be of use as a volunteer, but if/when I come back to India I will definitely check volunteering opportunities out! And p.s: the bears are adorable. If I was leaving agra any later I would have visited again tomorrow.

title: Bear lovers, choose the right weather...
review: Its an amazing place. Its a well maintained place. other attractions nearby are the elephant rescue centre and lake for boating.

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: What an inspirational place.  Delightful people who are passionate about the bears and also about helping the communities who need to be re-educated having used dancing bears to make a living for generations.  Clean, tranquil and we were the only tourists there when we visited in April.

title: Excellent educational visit.
review: Awesome visit. This is not a zoo nor is it a safari. But, I was able to understand firsthand the tragedy behind the lives of these sloth bears. Self and colleagues left a bit sad but with some resolve to do what we can to improve the wild-life on animals on this planet.

title: Amazing place
review: What a fantastic place.  The care that they give their elephants and bears is incredible.  You can tell how passionate they are about taking care of their animals and keeping them all healthy and happy.

title: Mind Blowing
review: I recommend everyone to visit this place to see the amazing work done for bear rehabilitation.

title: must visit place on Agra trip
review: This is a place we come to know how the the bears are very well maintained in their natural environment after their rescue from horrific past as dancing bear. Kudos to NGO who is taking care. I recommend everyone to visit this place to see the amazing work done for bear rehabilitation. This is a role model for animal rehab centers. Facilities may be improved with a support from all of us.

title: Life time Experience
review: Dear all,

title: Worth a visit!
review: Seeing the amazing work that Wildlife SOS has done and is doing is fantastic.They are all dedicated in making sure the bears have the best possible life after their horrific one as a dancing bear. Knowing that they, along with other animal organisations, have managed to save all of the dancing bears in India is truly amazing. We had a very enjoyable day seeing the bears, the hospital, helping with food prep and meeting and talking with staff. It was very informative. The day went by far too quickly, would love to visit again!

title: Amazing Experience!
review: I had an incredible day at the Wildlife SOS center, with my hosts Arpit and the rest of the gang.  Their hospitality was humbling, showing me around their wildlife rescue facilities (for bears and a separate campus 15 minutes away that we later visited for elephants) as a one-on-one tour, and even providing lunch.  These guides were fantastic - they were informative and very personable.  It was an incredible experience to spend time so close to these rescued animals.  I loved the bears but truly connected with the elephants, and it was very meaningful to me to be able to touch them and even bathe them - how many times do we get to experience wildlife like this in an environment that actually protects and helps these animals?!  I would definitely recommend this to anyone in the region; its a must do if you are in Agra, but I even made the day trip from Delhi, and with the new highway, it's a long day (2-3 hours each way with traffic), but doable.  They work with a transportation agency that knows the location of the facility and can provide door to door service from your hotel in Delhi.  Don't think twice - book it and enjoy Indian hospitality from the wonderful staff while you spend a fantastic day with these beautiful, precious animals!

title: Lovely place, def worth visiting
review: We visited recently and had a lovely guide called Prat, he was extremely informative and engaging. Was a bit hot when we went so lots of the bears were feeling the heat too!

title: MUST not miss when in India
review: I recently visited the Agra Bear Rescue facility as well as the Elephant Haven (both run by an amazing organization, Wildlife SOS, which I have been following for several years now.) The hosts were extremely gracious to me and in addition to seeing the bears, Dr. Raja (chief vet) even showed me the operating theatre and mutiple interesting case x-rays of various animals he has treated at the center. Both Kartick and Geeta (co-founders of WSOS) were at the facility with us and we had lunch and dinner with them. It is important to note that all these bears were rescued from a miserable life of torture that once endured as being "dancing bears" utilized by the Kalandar communities.

title: Helping those who even can't ask for...
review: Words cannot do wildlife sos justice, it's adventure, emotions, thrill and beauty simply has to be seen to be appreciated.

title: Great place to visit
review: This is about an hour from the main tourist spots in Agra (in the direction of Delhi) and worth a visit if you care about wildlife.

title: Excellent, Informative Tour!
review: We arranged for a tour and were met by Prat once we arrived at the facility. It was fascinating to learn about the history of the sloth bear and to see the care with which the facility nurtures them back.

title: Worth a visit
review: Our trip to Wildlife SOS was a highlight of our trip to India.  We visited Elephant Haven and learned about the work that Wildlife SOS does to rescue bears and elephants from horrible situations.  We were also able to feed the elephants, which is such an incredible experience.  Wildlife SOS really rolled out the red carpet for our group.  It's definitely worth the visit!

title: An inspiration
review: During our recent trip to India, my 10 year old son and I were fortunate enough to be able to visit the Wildlife SOS Bear Sanctuary near Agra where we were able to meet some of the rehabilitated sloth bears and learn first hand how the Wildlife SOS has successfully ended the barbaric practice of "dancing bears" in India. A fantastic achievement. The founders have done, and continue to do, the most amazing work in Wildlife conservation in general and are an inspiration to all of us. I would fully recommend including a visit to this sanctuary or one of their other sanctuaries (they also have an Elephant Rescue Centre) in your itinerary.

title: Wildlife SOS journey
review: We went there and saw one of the most amazing creatures who had been rescued for good. Kudos to their team for such noble work. Also the beauty of the surroundings / nature made us go spellbound. Really an amazing experiece and everyone should visit once atleast.

title: A peaceful place in an often hectic town.
review: Wildlife S.O.S has done an amazing job with the bear and elephant rescue sanctuaries. You can not skip this, you will be missing out on an opportunity of a lifetime to see up close and personal, rescued animals and social change.  Many thanks to Kartick and staff. I can't wait to return.

title: Wild visit at Wildlife SOS
review: A visit to wildlife SOS park only makes you wanna come back sooner then you would think. They bring us closer to the nature and some harsh realities of our society. Good work put in by the management towards rescue and rehabilitation of animals is highly commendable. We were greeted by Prathmesh and Naresh at the Elephant Facility and had unimaginable welcome later by Chanchal, Maya and Laxmi with there other elephant friends. Kids loved being so up and close with these gentle giants and getting friendly with them. They even helped give them a bath and feed them. It was a memorable experience and would go a long way in enriching there thoughts on co existence in this world. At the bear park, besides meeting Maharani, Bijli, Bobby and other beautiful bears we also met Devil, Angel and Richard Parker. A big thanks to Baiju Raj also for offering us a wonderful meal in middle of the jungle which was treat.

title: Excellent facilities
review: Prathamesh gave us a very interesting tour of the sloth bear sanctuary and also the recently founded Elephant Haven. It is really refreshing to see actual animal welfare having a positive impact.

title: Fantastic work in Agra
review: We took a trip to Sur Sarovar bird sanctuary and found the Sloth Bear facility inside. It's a great place to visit and experience the hard work being done in rescuing these fab animals from the dance trade and also educating the village people who partake in such activities. A really positive experience.

title: Meet Maya ...4600 kgs of Magic !
review: Like most people visiting Agra, this city was all about the monument of love and reputation that precedes it...but over the years and many visits later  ...the monument is just that a structure ...a beautiful one at that. A visit to the Wildlife SOS center will tell you why love cannot be stone building...it is has to full of life and preferably weigh 4600 + kilos  :)

title: And they are free to live..
review: It was more than 25 years ago on a college study tour to Agra that I saw the dancing bears for the first time. I don't remember what I thought of it, I am sure I must have also stood by and watched. Realization came in much later once I was fully entrenched in the tourism industry and to see these beautiful creatures at the mercy of a string and ring made me sick and I always looked away. Is'nt that what we all do, look away wishing that this atrocity did not exist. But when I went to see the rescue centre two years ago.... it was with awe and some more tears at the work and space that has been created for the dancing bears. And last month....my heart let out a silent 'yipee' when Dr. Baiju mentioned that India is free from the atrocious tradition of the kalandars and the dancing bears. Super work and a great facility and a must visit for us Indians and also sensitize our children to what we have done to animals.  Would also love to see the rehabilitation of all kinds of animals take place across the country. There are so many many more innocent animals and birds that suffer as they mean livelihood for humans. There are many more ways to earn bread.... like work for example. Lets leave the animals to live their lives in the jungles. Please....

title: Get close to the bears.
review: Apart from the Taj there's not a huge number of attractions in Agra so as animal lovers we opted for the bear sanctuary.

title: Wonderful !
review: I've been sponsoring a bear at this centre and as a sponsor I had a  private guided tour and of course, during this tour, I met "my" bear.

title: Amazing visit to the Ebars and elephants!!
review: Costs 500 rs/person to enter to the bear rescue Centre. We came in a time when the bears were resting(noon), but it was still nice to see them so close! The information films helped understanding the background of Wildlife SOS better, watch them!

title: A wonderfull day!
review: It was an amazing experience to visit this place and it made me very happy to see how nice they took care of the animals! And it was awesome to be with the elephants and to cudle with them! Something I gladley would recommend! Not even the Taj Mahal could beat this experience!

title: fantastic facility
review: Just returned from an amazing visit to this wonderful facility which is generating positive change for man and animal alike in India. Worth the effort to visit and support- lots of fun and memorable for the whole family- don't miss it!

title: a fantastic sanctuary
review: I have been back to the Agra bear sanctuary a few times now.  After years of seeing these poor animals being tortured on the side of the road it is so wonderful that this organisation has now rescued every dancing bear from the streets of India and created havens for them to spend their final years in luxury.  Very special experience.  They also have an elephant sanctuary on the outskirts of Agra for retired working elephants from Delhi so its worth asking if you can go there too.

title: Memorable and Inspirational, Agra Bear Rescue Facility
review: You won't regret your visit to this beautiful wildlife sanctuary.Here are housed over 250 of the most magnificent creatures; the iconic Asiatic Black Bears. A personal guided tour is offered to any visitors and you can see the rehabilitated bears up close. We had an in depth history session on the dancing bear practise in India/Nepal. We learnt about their sad upbringing, brutal treatment and the widespread conservation efforts, as this practise is now outlawed throughout the country. Our guide, Prathamesh had only been there a short time, but was very knowledgeable and conveyed immense passion for his work. He was happy to answer all of our many questions.

title: A MUST VISIT FOR ALL ANIMAL LOVERS
review: Sur Sarova sloth bear sanctuary, just out of Agra, is a must visit, if you are in the Agra area. They are saving sloth bears from a barbaric life as dancing bears and have around 250 in the sanctuary. Wildlifesos is doing a brilliant job and need some financial help. We are now paying towards the bear sanctuary upkeep and are in the proces of adopting a bear. They have pandolins, snakes and spotted deer here as well. But the bears are the most important reason to visit. It broke my heart to see the video of what happens to them as youngsters when they are caught and taken into slavery.

title: Good to see the Sloth Bear
review: Good if you are a lover of animals....we had a short visit, but we were pleased to see the sloth bears up close, it is set a little outside the city in a serene peaceful park near the lake...but there could have been more conservation efforts to maintain the lake

title: Absolutely worthwhile - for animal lovers
review: What an amazing place. Yes, the reviews are true that the government overcharges for access to the park but it is for a good cause.

title: Visit if you can
review: This is a great operation which rescues performing sloth bears and elephants from lives of abuse. You can visit the animals and talk to the staff and learn more about the projects they do.  Make a small donation if you can - they're not really equipped to handle many visitors and really appreciate any help you can provide.

title: Trust that these animals are being well cared for
review: My husband and I visited the Elephant Haven last week. It was wonderful to get to know all seven elephants and to have the chance to learn about the incredible work Wildlife SOS is doing. My only regret is that I didn't have the opportunity to spend more time there.

title: Best place in Agra......
review: Hands down the best wildlife facilities we've seen in India. They rehab both the bears and the former bear-dancers. Great people dong great work!

title: Eye-opening experience
review: This rescue facility is amazing. It was a very moving experience for us and even our Indian driver had never been. The 10 minute movie we saw described very well and movingly the plight of bears in India who in the past were made to perform for people.

title: Such a shame!
review: To enter you pass through a bird sanctuary. I only wanted to visit the bears because I wanted to donate & mind take some photos. I didn't plan on spending more than an hour. I ended up paying for my driver, my previous Agra guide, the car, myself... All of which I didn't mind but then had to pay 1000 rupees!! Just for a camera. I have travelled the world & never paid this much for a camera! Even to see the orangutans close up in borneo cost much less! The bears had been fed so we hardly saw any. The bird sanctuary was ok but not many birds lovely for a picnic though.

title: The Bears!
review: We had such a great visit! Learning about the story of the dancing bears was amazing and most of our group members were in tears. I am so glad of the efforts of this organization, rescuing these beautiful creatures and educating the handlers.

title: Great experience with kids
review: We visited this place with our 3 kids who were impressed about the bear experience and the cruelty of some men. Great lesson for them.

title: Best Experience of Indian Trip
review: We had read about this place before are holiday to India. So we made plans to visit it while in Agra. We visted Taj Mahal in the morning and went to the sanctuary after. We had other plans for the rest of the day after the sanctuary visit, but cancelled these to stay at the sanctuary. Apart from the bears (our main reason to visit) there are other animals to see. To hear that all the dancing bears in captivity in India were now re homed, was a great relief. We saw lots of bear playing and feeding. When I get home I will be sponsering a bear.

title: Superb experience of Charity in Action
review: A visit is well worth the effort especially if combined with Fatehpur Sikri. Hire a car and driver for this. The Bears are well cared and the guides are friendly and informative. You can have a really close encounter with the Bears as they are used to humans despite their previous ill-treatment. A wonderful experience not to be missed. A refreshing change after viewing all those dusty monuments. See charity in action first hand.

title: dont visit. donate.
review: Me and my boyfriend went to visit the Sloth bears after reading reviews on tripadvisor. It took an hour to get there and we spent less then 30mins in the place. The man that greeted us was very nice and told us all about what they do. And i believe the place is excellent for what they are doing and we watched a very moving video. But really watching the video and a quick walk past some sleeping bears was all there is to see. I would recommend that you visit there website and send the money you would on cab fair and tips and make a donation to them!!!

title: A wonderful place
review: Loved this place. Was actually the highlight of Agra. Manu (who showed us round) and all the staff and doctors here are amazing. A great example of "poachers turned gamekeepers". To see these lovely creatures living out their days in peace after years of horrific abuse is really moving. Not to be missed. Also a great bird park on same site but we didn't have time to visit this.

title: Great place for bears.
review: It is sad that the bears were used as props for mankind to make money from, but they do have a great life here at the rescue. They might allow you to take photos, but ask that you don't post them. The place looked nice with large enclosures, enrichment for the bears and nice hospital and food prep rooms.

title: Inspiring Experience
review: A friend told us about this, and we are so glad we added it to our itinerary.  The access security was a little overwhelming and scary, but the visit to the Bear Rescue centre was definitely worth it.  Pity we couldn't take photos of our visit to remember and share the good work they are doing.

title: Worth seeing
review: While initially depressing, the sanctuary is doing an important deed for the animals -- and the community.  They are doing great job.  Worth seeing.

title: Better than the Taj Mahal
review: The wonderful people at Wildlife SOS have truly made an animal utopia.  They rescue abused bears and elephants as well as abandoned animals such as geese and guinea fowl.  The animals all have very large, clean enclosures and the staff really care about them.

title: Magestic creatures being well cared for
review: I found out about the Agra Bear Rescue Facility and Elephant Conservation and Care Centre by chance, but so glad I did.
